ReviewContent: They make amazing cocktails! Carlos, a super nice and friendly bartender, made this lovely pink lady.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Min L.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Their website says "Open Late." This apparently means midnight. Very disappointing considering we had to pay $30. Events begin around 9, that's only 3 hours if you get there right when it opens. That's about $10/hour! Which is insane considering vibes don't get good until at least 1 hour after opening. The music was good but any positive feeling left all of my group when we realized we had overpaid for a 2 hour experience. Will not come back until they increase their hours and lower their prices!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Andrea M.", "AuthorLocation": "Chula Vista, CA"}

ReviewContent: Why does the club end at 12:00pm on a Saturday night? On the website it says that it closes at 2:00am. Make it make sense!!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Olivia L.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great little beer joint with some solid options! Bar tender/waiter was super helpful recommending and explaining some of the beers to us. We enjoyed two salads in the laid back open bar atmosphere which was really nice. Both salads were huge and delicious. No live music, we popped in on a Friday when it was pretty empty.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Lori L.", "AuthorLocation": "Miami, FL"}

ReviewContent: Attended a fun party in the lobby area and we had a great time. The staff was very professional and creative trying to find us as we moved around within the group. We didn't even make it back to the show area!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Lou P.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: After being told numerous times about Cornerstone, I decided to try it. I got a board with salami, cheddar, and Brussel sprouts. It was good. Very friendly staff, they were able to give me recommendations since it was my first time. Overall, I would recommend this place.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Reece L.", "AuthorLocation": "Burlingame, CA"}

ReviewContent: I finally took the time to come to Cornerstone Berkeley.  It was surprisingly empty when I came in, with only 4 other customers inside.  I had the Avocado Burger with fries and 2 beers (Cornerstone Blonde).  They tasted great.  I also liked the 4 TV hanging above the bar area, where you can watch several different sporting events.  When I went to the restroom, I noticed the concert area for the live shows.  Rather small for a concert area for my tastes, but if I ever see an event to my liking, I will try to come.   The staff was friendly and helpful, big shout out to them.  I will try to come at a later hour on my next trip here, just to see the larger crowd that come here.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Alex W.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: Went here on February 22, 2024 to watch Save Ferris with The Aquadolls opening for them. One of the best live concerts I've ever been to! Had such a blast. The venue had a cozy atmosphere, great acoustics, good vibes. Would definitely recommend to anyone who wants to catch a live show here!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Maureen P.", "AuthorLocation": "Clayton, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great venue for live music! Petty Theft was a blast. Friendly service. Huge beer selection.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Vicki L.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: Cornerstone is a beautiful space to e enjoy a nice cocktail or beer. We had the chicken wings and they were very good. The service is warm and friendly. We've been twice now and are putting it into our rotation.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Mizz G.", "AuthorLocation": "CA, CA"}

ReviewContent: Depending on how much time you have before seeing a show here, you can have drinks, maybe snacks, or full on dinner. If I'm hungry, I go for the burger and fries (sweet potato is good too). They've got quite a few beers on tap and some ciders too, and the last time we were here, there was a promo happening for a tequila company so we got some free shots! Can't speak for any mixed cocktails though - I've always gotten beer or cider. If there's a game on, folks do stop in to enjoy them on several of the screens lining the walls. Great spot for groups! Service is usually pretty smooth and friendly, but we tend to nosh early and haven't experienced super slammed bartenders or servers. There's also a bar at the music hall, and a  mezzanine level to sit and watch the show from if you don't want standing room only on the main floor.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Christina C.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: It's a large support full bar and restaurant with many screens and projectors around. Great for sport watching, groups, casual hangouts and meetups.There are big runs for private parties with screen in the back.Not kids friendly on busy game days but could still be nice on regular days!Service is great with many responsive attentive staff.Foods are petty good American. I'd recommend burger fries sausage tri-tips pulled pork pretty much everything is good after couple pitcher of good beer  It's a very reasonable price and good quality of food.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Max K.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: Have been coming here for years. Tonight we were promptly and rudely told last call was happening at 8:10 and that we'd have to leave in 20 minutes. They kicked 40ish people out at 8:30!!! There were lots of people in there! Many of us wanted to get more drinks and hang out for a little while. The bartender was beyond rude and told everyone they had to be put in 20 minutes. Online it says they are open until midnight and on their website it just says they're open late! I'm sorry but 8:30 is not open late anywhere u go!! Will never ever be back!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Gabriel L.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Came for happy hour bites - pretzel, taquitos, carnitas nachos and some cocktails. Wasn't too busy for a Tuesday night probably because it was rainy and cold outside. I've been here before for drinks. They have a full bar and beer tap menu which is nice and the small eats are helpful when drinking. There's also an outside patio area when it's nice out. The place is big not counting the concert venue area. Good place to hang with friends.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Tracy D.", "AuthorLocation": "Albany, CA"}

ReviewContent: I would give 5 stars but my friend and I came to watch the game, we come here all the time btw. There were a lot of bartenders behind the bar and none came to take our order, but a lot of them were more attentive to the men. However, tonight Carlos and Javier were the ONLY ones being attentive to everyone, actually being inclusive. I'd love to give 5 stars tonight but only for Carlos, Javier and Jen.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Nohemy G.", "AuthorLocation": "North & East, Richmond, CA"}

ReviewContent: First time here and it was good and a lot of fun. Just to note that the ceilings are high and it's very loud inside. There are many beers on the menu. Food was good. The music venue was fun. Saw a friend from Los Angeles play. Have to come back and try something.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Greg W.", "AuthorLocation": "Manteca, CA"}

ReviewContent: I've been coming to Cornerstone since before the pandemic and it's been cool to see its various evolutions. I actually saw Andre Nikatina like 2 nights before the initial shelter in place. I love an intimate music venue so I def recommend going there if you enjoy that kind of vibe. As far as restaurant/bar/outside seating, I also really enjoy this spot! The bartenders have always been on point, super engaging and speedy. Their drinks update regularly and they're always strong and tasty. Their beer menu is extensive and impressive. There are a lot of TVs and they always play the games! The outside seating is also enjoyable. It's a fun vibey yet low key place. I am definitely biased cause I met my boyfriend here two years ago so it has a special place in my heart.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "May Z.", "AuthorLocation": "Lake Merritt, Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great tap list. The food is always spot on. Friendly staff.  Haven't seen a show here, but the have an interesting line up.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Sarah G.", "AuthorLocation": "Ellensburg, WA"}

ReviewContent: You're awesome...musically beverages and food. Right by Bart yes. Love the lit up Marque too.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "James P.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: The food is awesome here! Beer selection is very good as well. I highly recommend the chicken pot pie. Sauce was creamy and tangy. My companions were very happy with their burgers. Great place to hit before Cal Basketball. Prices are reasonable also.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Adrian A.", "AuthorLocation": "Danville, CA"}

ReviewContent: Surprised to see lot reviews for this place. It's very open and clean. Wide selection of drinks. Smaller food menu but I had the pork belly nachos and they were delicious!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Megan R.", "AuthorLocation": "Emeryville, CA"}

ReviewContent: This is one of my favorite bars to go to after work! They have a lot of seating options and a huge bar. I love the warm pretzel with cheese and they serve a great Kentucky Mule! Ideal for small or large groups. They have shows here too but I haven't checked them out yet.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Cassandra T.", "AuthorLocation": "El Cerrito, CA"}

ReviewContent: I attended a concert here on 12-16-23. Small venue which normally I do like but there was a very drunk attendee who was deliberately shoving people in the crowd unprovoked. I did tell security and they shrugged at me. Later, the guy walked out on his own because he was so drunk. I can only assume he was never let back in. It is unclear if he was too drunk to come back in or if security actually declined him reentry. I have never felt so unsafe at a concert.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Erica W.", "AuthorLocation": "San Leandro, CA"}

ReviewContent: Love the large open seating, lots of space in and outdoor, the fire pits outside are really nice as well. They are dog friendly and a good drink selection. I haven't tried the food, but all the bites look delicious. Great space for small or large groups.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Taylor L.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: Cornerstone hosted a surprise birthday party for my husband. Stef was so helpful and thorough throughout the planning process and during the event! The food that was catered by Cornerstone was delicious!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Jamie W.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: Came here for a metal show, and I ended up eating the best damn pulled pork sandwich and sweet potato fries I've ever had. Great beer selection, too. What a pleasant surprise to go along with headbanging all night.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Jim O.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: Have been here a couple times. This place has a pretty large floor plan, including an outdoor area. The beer selection is good, and the staff is pleasant usually. The music venue is very basic and sound quality isn't the best but if you have a solid artist playing then none of that matters. Small venue but I enjoy it!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Christine F.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great local place. Went here late a few days in a row and we had a great time. Live music is upstairs but they did stream in downstairs one of the nights we were there. Drinks and good and staff are very friendly.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Stephan B.", "AuthorLocation": "Los Angeles, CA"}

ReviewContent: Asshole bartender today who doesn't know what beer he is serving.  They didn't have waiters so we had to deal with him for our order.  Food was terrible.  Gross greasy bread for the sandwich.  Won't be back unless there is a good show and we will eat ahead of time somewhere else.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Joye ..", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: I just needed a glass of beer. But they double charged me... I am glad that I checked my receipt before I get drunk.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Akiko K.", "AuthorLocation": "Alameda, CA"}

ReviewContent: Atrocious service. I've sat at the bar and been ignored and then told 25 minutes later that when there's a crowd, you have to go to a line in the middle to order. Okay, that sucks, but whatever. But then another night when there was less than 15 people in the whole place and no line, I was once again ignored. They don't know how to run a bar.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Mike M.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: This review is for Justin at cornerstone  his service and personal touch with customers is great.   The brick and mortar matters but the service is why we return over and over again.    Food is good quality beer options are a plenty , the outside is nice to enjoy lunch.  Evening time gets it's own review and is also same service Mendoza the manager took care of us since he started .  Another go to lunch and after work decompress spot.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "jason c.", "AuthorLocation": "Pinole, CA"}

ReviewContent: This is the worst place to go to see live music, comedy, or any event. This loud man who was over served was feeding his underage children alcohol and yelling at a man next to us. He seemed to know someone in charge and told the white hair glasses guy that this tall man was touching his dancing wife and daughter. One of the 4 kids also tried to fight the tall guy!! To solve this issue, glasses guy in charge put the tall guy in the VIP area?? Then, anyone who stood near dancing wife got assaulted. No one will do anything about it. But I kept getting bumped into by the people fighting, security, and staff. We left before the band went on. I'm so disappointed I could die. I think this so what happens when a venue serves alcohol for 2.5+ hours before the band goes on and has bad security and people in charge who are dumb. The last time I saw a comedy show here I thought it was a really weird venue but it was seated with cheap fold out chairs and uncomfortable wobbly stools. Bad vibes 100%z
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Claire B.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: I like what this place used to be but the last few times I have gone to corner stone the bartenders have been rude and acted like they don't care.  I was left standing waiting to order while the bartenders talked for a few minutes and looked at me as though I was inconveniencing them.  When one of them finally came over to me they acted annoyed and like they did not want me there.  I wish the staff was nicer because I live around the corner and would come here on the regular but I will take my business to other places for now and maybe try again in a year or two.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Tomas T.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: This place made me wanna come the next day, man it was delicious. Place was very welcoming and waiters were super friendly great vibe over all. The music was great. If you are a pickle freak then that place is for you they tasted to gooooood. Overall I would come again definitely hope they continue to thrive!!!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Crystal S.", "AuthorLocation": "CA, CA"}

ReviewContent: As a music venue, this location is fire, right next to a bookshop and many other glorious Berkeley food options. Their AC/ventilation was killer (which is crucial for a hardcore concert in August) and the setup was simultaneously intimate but spacious and professional. Things were kept super tidy and welcoming in the concert space and the setup just worked. Not to mention, the show (Hail the Sun) was absolutely phenomenal with regards to lighting and sound. The only thing that lost this sick venue a star was the kinda crappy service from specifically the venue area staff. The bartenders and restaurant hosts were awesome, but the guys dealing with ticketing and admission were short, snarky, and not super helpful while my group had a minor ticketing scanning complication. We were pointed in three different places before getting the problem sorted by manually checking the attendant list (lol). They also didn't have bag checks/detectors at the door but that wasn't a concern (esp. given there was security present in the venue during the show), just an fyi for others. Ultimately, this place is a solid venue that I'm looking forward to revisiting one day.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Selah H.", "AuthorLocation": "Gridley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Where do I even begin with this absolute dumpster fire of a place? If I could give it zero stars, I would, because that's honestly what it deserves.It's abundantly clear that the owner's attitude towards both staff and hygiene sets the tone for the entire establishment.The mere fact that the owner is so disrespectful to his staff was reason enough for us to never return to this place. Not to mention, the place was so dirty we refrained from ordering anything that came out of the kitchen even though we were hungry.Save your time, money, and and peace of mind by never coming to this place.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Stephanie P.", "AuthorLocation": "SoMa, San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: Dirty space / bad service/ fruit flies. Maybe it was an off day but I was at the bar for an hours and had to get up to flag someone down. Ended up closing out and not getting a second beer.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Eliott G.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Came here for a metal show about a week ago. Staff were friendly. The venue had great sound. I love the second floor option for viewing. Stayed up the for the majority of the time. Plus, I love the option of seating upstairs. Didn't need a VIP pass :]
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Gabrielle C.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: I just popped in here for something to eat on a recommendation. Was mid day so pretty quiet but the food was quick and delicious, and the beer menu was quite large. It's a venue and some folks were talking about the show that night but I didn't stick around for that.  Solid option in the area, and perfect stop while waiting to grab a train home.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Thomas M.", "AuthorLocation": "NY, NY"}

ReviewContent: French dip was good - service was good and easy access to music venue right after grabbing a bite !
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Zara T.", "AuthorLocation": "Castro Valley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Excellent service from the Alex, the bartender!  Cornerstone is lucky to have him. On top of that, great place to get good food and see a show. Oh, also they have a great selection of beer!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Nick F.", "AuthorLocation": "San Diego, CA"}

ReviewContent: This spot is really popular and very spacious inside, but I think the vibe just isn't for me. It's really really loud but not in a calming nice way, but a kind that makes me more annoyed. They have a lot of different beers/cider options but not many cocktails which makes sense given the name, but I'm not really the biggest fan of beer in general. If you are though, you'd probably enjoy this place a lot more!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Katherine G.", "AuthorLocation": "Seattle, WA"}

ReviewContent: first time here and had a seat at the bar. really nice casual atmosphere with amazing drinks and delicious food. Service was quick and our bartender always made sure to check back in with us. We had the smoked chicken wings with chipotle sauce and the kale & butternut salad both were really good.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Christina M.", "AuthorLocation": "Vacaville, CA"}

ReviewContent: Horrible never again. I went to to go suga  Free yesterday and left early. The place didn't have seating it was standing room only. The person I was with had a disability and we asked for accommodation they told use we couldn't do that. We ask for our money back and was to we couldn't get our money back and was told we had to talk to management on Monday. If you have a disability I do not recommend this place. I seriously thinking about making a report with the ADA and the city.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Dejeiner K.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: Came here for a concert and checked out the bar in the meantime. Huge space and lots of nice seating everywhere. Beers were decent as well. Found the venue to be pretty decent for a smaller sized one.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Taylor Z.", "AuthorLocation": "New York, NY"}

ReviewContent: When I called to let them know about the incorrect charges they offered for me to come back and they would buy me and my friends a round of free drinks. When they texted me I got a super creepy vibe and never went back. Disputed through my bank to get my money back.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Jasmine W.", "AuthorLocation": "Los Angeles, CA"}

ReviewContent: The crew at this bar is As amazing as the amount of taps they have at this place! Will be back most definitely!!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Gabe L.", "AuthorLocation": "CA, CA"}

ReviewContent: This place and its staff are excellent they helped me get a ring back that wasn't worth much buy I cared for a lot. Food is great and they've got decent options for your bucks. The dip sandwich was really good and the fries were perfect. I was next door at a show and it's nice to have a restaurant a part of your experience. The beer selection is amazing aswell. Very clean place its spotless for a club
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Rob W.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: Went to this place and the atmosphere was great, friendly people and staff. I went to see two bands play, it was coordinated well, the staff was great with accommodations, and the sound system for the bands was AWESOME!! I recommend going and checking it out! I didn't eat there but seeing others food being served was very appealing and looked amazing!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Frank N.", "AuthorLocation": "San Pablo, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great place! I saw a band in the live space and the sound was great and the bar was well tended. The front space is open and nice and full of TVs for watching sports and stuff. I didn't eat anything but what I saw looked great. I am looking for a reason to go back there soon.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Nelson W.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: We had a nice time attending a show at cornerstone. We had dinner beforehand, and the food was quite tasty. They have a large beer selection and complementary pub food.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Richard P.", "AuthorLocation": "Pleasant Hill, CA"}

ReviewContent: The wife and I hade a concert lined up here and decided to try the food before the show. The beer selection is extensive, with over 20 selections of craft IPAs, Hazys, lagers and pilzners. And a hefty selection of darks as well. Oh, and ciders too!If you need to line your belly before imbibing there's is a good selection of bar food options: mix and match meat and cheese boards and sausage boards, starters like nachos, wings and more. Oh, and a few salad choices.Bigger appetites can be tamed with hot sandwiches, burgers or mains that consists of fish and chips, chicken pot pie, ribs or a giant 2/2 pound meatball. Really!The bar area is quite large with a lot of peripheral seating.The music Ben is a definite plus and Uber convenient.We enjoyed our burger and sandwiches. The wait staff is pretty efficient and friendly and the location is great for a social meetup. Parking is not a problem and is typically a short walking distance away. We will be back.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Tim H.", "AuthorLocation": "Castro Valley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Shows cancel, things happen. This place takes care of business. Paige is an asset to the music! Thank you!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Dr. O.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great venue, nice menu but VERY frustrating I can't make a reservation to ensure a nice night out. I have a group of 10 gals gathered to go to a show on a Saturday night, and our choices are: A) Take our chances we'll get a tableB) Get there super early and twiddle our thumbs for a couple of hours before the show startsI'm more likely to book a table at another spot nearby that will make a reservation. I don't need the kind of stress of either Plan A or B
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Lara S.", "AuthorLocation": "San Anselmo, CA"}

ReviewContent: Nice large airy spot. Under the fans feels healthy, tho freezing - can't have everything! Happy hour well-priced, and warm pretzel perfect on a cold evening. Nice way of ordering charcuterie, i.e. choose your own. Def ordered too much, but it was all good, and easy to take home. Only downside is having to wait to order at the bar. While friends are catching up, one may be stood alone behind a very long line. Would be nice to have mobile order at the table.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Leah F.", "AuthorLocation": "Albany, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great place to have craft beer, cocktail or a glass of wine. I enjoyed watching the Warrior game on a cold week day night with a local IPA. The service was excellent. On two separate occasions I tried the BLT salad with add chicken & a burger. The food is comfort, pub grub. The salad was large with egg, tomato's, chicken & croutons. The burger was juicy & flavorful. The ambiance is red brick, open & pretty loud. They offer live music next door which seems like it would be a great venue to see a band.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Kevin B.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: I've been to Cornerstone a number of times and experienced some plusses and minuses.  The first positive point is that the place is cavernous, as several other reviewers have stressed.  If you come with a group and camp out at one of the tables, you'll have plenty of room to stretch and lots of opportunities to walk around.  The second is that the beer list is extensive and really interesting.  There were about four or five Christmas ales this week, plenty of cloudy IPAs, a bunch of sours, etc., etc.  If you want to taste a beer or two before ordering your pint, no problem.The people who work here seemed awful nice to me.  I absolutely wanted to point that out.On the negative side: The kitchen closes at 7PM on some weeknights, even though the bar is in principle open until midnight.  Don't come looking for food unless you're sure that it'll be available.  The food menu is A-OK, but really nothing special.  I ordered an All-American Burger and was only vaguely satisfied with it -- it was cooked more than I had specified and didn't have all that much taste.  The food here takes a back seat to everything else.  That's fine if you're coming by to watch some sports on the TV and to knock back some excellent beer, but I don't see any Michelin stars on the horizon.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Kenneth R.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Very cute and cozy place to have a beer and a pretzel in the middle of the day. The pretzel is next level and I will not soon forget it
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "B. M.", "AuthorLocation": "Harrington, Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: I'm leaving a star because we walked in and got assisted without our ID's not being checked so that's always cool. Okayyyyy. I don't think I've ever left a bad review. Walked up to the bar to ask about the music and got interrupted and told to order with a bartender. Okay, no problem. I asked my question anyway. What time does the music usually start and what's good on the menu? I don't know was the answer and order down there was the rest of the reply. I was confused but walked on down to the middle of the bar where it looked like someone was bartending. I couldn't figure out where a menu was so I picked up a "taped" menu but accident ripped it off the bar! Omg so embarrassing sorry I said. The bartender said "Yeah. That's on there for a reason", finally I got someone's attention! Yay ! I continued to apologize. But by the time I decided on what food to eat the bartender was walking outside of the bar with tape and scooted me over to retape the menu. WTF.... He was annoyed and I was still confused. There are just so many ways to be nice. Choose one.   A new bartender came to help. I asked about beer because it's a brewery I thought, she had no idea what dark beers were on tap. Anyway blah blah blah I could go on. I will never come back
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Keri E.", "AuthorLocation": "San Diego, CA"}

ReviewContent: Cornerstone as a venue is great!!! Small and intimate stage setting. You can occasionally see some bigger name artists and they will sell out fast. You can go in and out if the venue which is pretty cool. The venue is attached to a bar/restaurant. For some reason they make everyone line up in a single file line to order drinks or food.  Then you get to put your order in and find a seat with a number. If you sit at the bar, they still make you go back in line every time. And the line gets long quickly, especially if there is a show. It seems absurd and I don't get it.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Kurt A.", "AuthorLocation": "Moraga, CA"}

ReviewContent: amazing. amazing. amazing. kind bar staff, warm and social environment, and the FOOD! I had the BBQ Bacon Cheeseburger and the Big A** Chocolate Cake. Both were delicious and the burger was cooked to perfection. Originally came just to go to a concert, but I'll definitely be coming back for the bar/food itself.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Nina S.", "AuthorLocation": "CA, CA"}

ReviewContent: We have 4 tickets to the James Hunter show from April 18, 2020.  We were told initially once he rescheduled that show that we would be able to use those tickets.  So, he has a show on October 14, 2022.  I haven't received any confirmation from Cornerstone regarding my tickets from 2020.  I've emailed them several times with ZERO response.  When I call I have been told the person I need to speak to only uses email.  We have been to a couple of shows at the Cornerstone and had a good time, it's a shame they aren't more responsive to their paying customers.  I cannot recommend this venue to anyone due to their unprofessional behavior.  It would be nice if they saw this review and responded to me but somehow I doubt it.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Julene R.", "AuthorLocation": "San Jose, CA"}

ReviewContent: Come here for a concert, get a pleasant surprise. What do I mean? Well, the food of course. This fire ass dining w/ insta worthy pics is the bees knees fa'sho. Deffo' a Gastro pub fans delight. The menu items are tapas with substance if that makes sense. Burrata, Manchego, Olives, bread, Chorizo, Sausage you name it. I'm a sucker for sweet potato fries and these are top five, they gotta be. Maybe I'm trippin' but that price had me dumbfounded because if I put that amount of food on a plate ( or attempted to ) I'd be out over 100 bucks and would likely fail in the taste department. Best bang for your buck pre dinner, pre concert, pre party -whatever. I can't wait to find any excuse to return ASAP.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Carlos F.", "AuthorLocation": "Greenbrae, CA"}

ReviewContent: Awesome place to grab drinks and food before a concert or watch a game!! Awesome place!!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Arturo A.", "AuthorLocation": "CA, CA"}

ReviewContent: Saw The Melvins show here last week, and loved the venue.  You can get earplugs at the bar.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Rudy R.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: My partner and I Have really enjoyed coming to this place we are both bay are natives and out all the places in the Berkeley/ Oakland area we always seemed to make our way back to corner stone. HOWEVER since the pandemic there has been less staff attending to customers. We understand that maybe on a Saturday night when it's busy it'll take a minute until someone notices that we're at the bar and is ready to take our order. Most of the time we go is during the week day when it is slower. We have gone there when there is maybe two bartenders at the bar and we are the only customers there. It has happened several times we will arrive sit down at the bar which would be completely empty except for the bartenders And it will take them 15 to 20 minutes to even greet us or acknowledge that they see us. A lot of the times will have to flag someone down or ask if we can get service. They don't really seem to want to help anyone. And if they do they seem to be in a rush and not really want to help the customer. For the most part service has declined a lot in the past two years. Aside from the fact that they don't have enough staff,  the little staff they do have are rude and never seem to want to help anyone. It is unfortunate because my partner and I really enjoy that place and we work not too far away so it's very convenient. But as of lately haven't been so motivated to return because of the horrible customer service. Sad because this place use to be great, hope something can be done soon.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Jemstudios J.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: I would normally give this place 5/5 stars but post pandemic there has been a major decline . This restaurant is apart of a 3 store franchise but the other two places are permanently closed. One would think resources would be put into this place . No one greets you when you walk in, they usually  have 1-2 bartenders , no waiters or greeters . Just always short staffed , there is usually a line at the Bar to get food or drinks but it's not really organized or uniform. It sucks because this is one of our favorite spots . We live and work around the area so this was our go to ----- service was so bad we went to Pappys - which is the same owners but Pappys is closed permanently . This place has the potential to be and stay as #1 bar , food, music venue but there needs to be a major step up in customer service.. cornerstone gets busy so if it is busy , forget about.....Getting a food or drink
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Rae W.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: We came for the entertainment, but were wonderfully surprised at the quality and craft of the food menu. Will be back again for sure. Lovely experience!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Valerie C.", "AuthorLocation": "CA, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great food, good beer selection and friendly staff. Came to Cornerstone to see a concert (which was awesome) but didn't realize that the restaurant and venue were literally attached. From pictures it looked like they were 2 separate buildings.Restaurant was cool, only suggestion I would have is to have instructions at the entrance. We waited a few minutes at the front where a host/hostess would be but weren't acknowledged, we realized the was a line in front of the bar and that was it.Other than that we enjoyed a delicious burger, wings and beer before the show.The venue is small but feels big and has a cool balcony area. Would definitely visit again!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Oscar V.", "AuthorLocation": "CA, CA"}

ReviewContent: Came here for a concert, since we arrived very early we decided to have a bite. I love how convenient it is that there is a restaurant & bar connected to a concert venue. I ordered the wings & my husband the burger, the service was fast & friendly & the food was delicious. You order both food & drink at the bar, which was kind of confusing because there wasn't really any instruction when you enter; we stood at the entrance by what looked like where a host would be standing & noticed no one acknowledged us we saw a line at the bar & decided to follow the crowd. The venue was great! Clean & small. My husband & I went up to the balcony, where they had stools to sit. They had a full bar inside the concert venue with beer & liquor with limited cocktail availability. My husband & I ordered a mojito & old fashioned and had to go into the bar in the restaurant to get those drinks as they don't have the ingredients inside the venue. Overall, we had a great time & can't wait to see what other shows they have going on in the future!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Giselle S.", "AuthorLocation": "Sonoma, CA"}

ReviewContent: This is only a review of Cornerstone as a venue - I caught a show here in May 2022, still haven't tried the food but would like to soon!As you come in you'll enter a huge indoor bar area with some outdoor seating in the back. The decor is pretty sparse and the place fees empty once the show has begun, I'd imagine on other nights the main room fills up more.Cool and helpful staff, the prices for everything are ok, parking is pretty bad as you'd expect in downtown berk but you can park on the street and expect to only have to walk about ten minutes. Solid selection of beer.Keep walking to the back and you'll find the entrance to the venue - it's surprisingly large, has its own bar, cool stage with a full lineup for the month, great crowd. Check it out!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Rusty S.", "AuthorLocation": "Pleasant Hill, CA"}

ReviewContent: Amazing staff I got An American burgerI like it I definitely recommend to visit this location
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Mohamed S.", "AuthorLocation": "CA, CA"}

ReviewContent: My husband and I were visiting from Maui and one of the security guards denied us because he thought that our Hawaii drivers licenses were fake. Mind you, we are 26 and married. We asked if he had proper training on fake ID's and he said no, but apparently he had "15 fake IDs in his life" and knows fake ID's better than the federal TSA agent at the airport that let me onto the plane. My encounter with him was unpleasant and he was certain that my drivers license was fake because of "McLovin". Best of luck to this brewery -- they're going to lose customers because of this improperly educated, unprofessional, and disrespectful guy whose knowledge of real ID's is based off of netflix movies. Never coming back again, good luck if you're from Hawaii
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Taija-Rae T.", "AuthorLocation": "Wailuku, HI"}

ReviewContent: The blonde bartender in the venue area not only has an attitude, but is also a thief. She cut me off  after my 3rd beer Friday night because I apparently "have had enough" I was watching one of my favorites bands Hypocrisy perform and she ruined the entire experience! So here we are 2 days later and I get a random $321 charge on my credit card for Shein.com; a woman's online clothing and apparel co. I check my credit card purchase and the last purchase prior to that was the bar in the venue with that rude blonde bartender! I will be launching an investigation on this! I was there to see a band I love perform and have a few drinks, not get scammed by the bartender!! ‍
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "James R.", "AuthorLocation": "Port Orford, OR"}

ReviewContent: showed them my real california ID and still got turned down. Probably because I'm a POC can't believe the service.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Clark B.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great beer list and the pulled pork sandwich was surprisingly delicious! Friendly service.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "jeffrey g.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Horrible staff. I went there to attend a live concert of Leprous and every single person working was rude. I found someone's cellphone in restroom and went to the guard to give it to them. Those two guards didnt say anything and just took the cell and gave a mean look. Even at the time of ordering food I felt menu was thrown at the table when I asked for the menu. Everyone had attitude and ego. Kind of ruined my night.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Basharat A.", "AuthorLocation": "Kensington, London, United Kingdom"}

ReviewContent: Spent a Saturday afternoon hanging with some friends sucking down some beers and a few appetizers. Prices were horrible but the beer selection was superb. Bartender was solo and managed to keep up with the volume. Having some sports on TV in the afternoon was a welcome surprise. Concert space was a good size and will be looking to catch a show someday.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Kevin K.", "AuthorLocation": "Concord, CA"}

ReviewContent: came here on a saturday night for a couple drinks. staff was nice enough, but the different cocktails we ordered were all too sweet. so much so that I question if alcohol was even present.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Peter M.", "AuthorLocation": "Sacramento, CA"}

ReviewContent: I don't like writing critical reviews. The food at Cornerstone is great, and the enclosed patio is perfect. BUT the service leaves a lot to be desired. I don't know if it's my age (71) or my walker, but the only way I can get the attention of a waiter here is to walk right up in front of him waving my hands. Is this some sort of unspoken policy to discourage older customers or does the younger crowd just not mind, but there are plenty of great restaurants in Berkeley where I feel welcome.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Jude B.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: 3 minutes left in the Warriors' game and they turned off the TVs. Beer is fine but the bartenders don't know how to make a cocktail. Food is pretty good. But seriously -- 3 minutes left and you kicked out everyone? Just dumb. Don't let kids run your bar.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Brent J.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: I think it's super cool that they have craft beer attached to a concert venue because it's a great place to hang out in before/after concerts. My husband and I have been to this venue twice and the experience has been great every time. AND the amount of beer choices they have are GREAT!This is located in downtown Berkeley though, so parking may be a little tough sometimes especially with all the great eateries surrounding the area.It's a big smaller than expected but the audio is always great in here and there's seating upstairs (we're old hahaha)! I know these are one of the few venues that actually provide seating and it's really clean in there.Taking out one star because admitting people in was a bit unclear for the attendees. Otherwise, one of the best venues I've been going to!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Kaye T.", "AuthorLocation": "Newark, CA"}

ReviewContent: I have been a patron here for many years (well before Covid). Throughout the years, I have experienced great folks, a great menu of food (great lunch deals), and great shows.I have been more of a regular as of late (early 2021) and Cornerstone does not disappoint. If you come during the day, chances are that Justin will be your bartender. He is a very cool (and personable) dude that knows his beers and cocktails He will recommend something to you with confidence based on your palette. He will even let you have a small taste of what's on tap just to be sure. Justin isn't a big IPA drinker; however, he has recommended a plethora of IPAs for me that are now considered my favorites. Yep, I am primarily an IPA beer drinker; however, I have learned to appreciate other drinks like the Old Fashioned and Vodka Martinis for the days that I want to change things up (thanks to Justin and Cornerstone). RJ (the beer selector/buyer), Gio, Lee, and the rest of the staff are amazing as well. Come by and visit for the music, drinks, and food. There is something for everyone's palette (drinks and food) mixed with fantastic customer service.  Thanks for the killerness, Cornerstone. Cheers.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Jay B.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great for music although very tough to find a seat if you're not there early. Food from restaurant was fine but kinda pricey for food wrapped in paper to take next door. Although the website says you can go through restaurant after you eat and markets the whole place as all you need, you have to actually go outside and enter through club doors and they stop serving food at 9. So be sure and eat before then. No snacks available at the bar either. But great music venue.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "E F.", "AuthorLocation": "Concord, CA"}

ReviewContent: Tried to eat here on Monday during MNF. Got there at 7:55. Kitchen was closed. Lame!  Manager didn't care that it was early and was rude to me.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Brian S.", "AuthorLocation": "Albany, CA"}

ReviewContent: My Friday night looked very boring ahead of me. I found this place and it looked empty, however the bright lights and modern deco invited me for a drink. Maybe two, or three? lost count a while ago...   (Yes I tipped the bartender well for putting up with me) definitely the place to go on a Friday night. Definitely coming back...definitely definitely. Thanks guys!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Gustavo C.", "AuthorLocation": "Emeryville, CA"}

ReviewContent: A welcome addition to Berkeley (3.5 Green Stars)I haven't written a review for two months - the guilt! Looking through my photos, I'm going to review places where I've been, in reverse order. First up is Cornerstone, and I have to say that I'm proud of this photo. A basket of fries and pint of Death & Taxes, sitting on my table in the evening light, took on the gravity and artistry of a masterwork by Vermeer or Degas. Anyhoo, after a solitary start with my beer and fries, it ended up being a big group - a post-lockdown work reunion - and I think everyone was pretty happy with their night. I like Cornerstone because it's one of those bars where you're more likely to mix with more people (within your own group or randos) rather than somewhere like Jupiter where people tend to not leave their seats. Not that I don't love Jupiter - the two places are similar in some ways but Cornerstone adds a level of chaos (but in a good way!). Good selection of beer and food, spacious and pretty - what more do you want?I'm also giving the Cornerstone 3.5 out of 5 "Green Stars" for social and environmental impact, based on this:* Large emphasis on local draft beer, which is so much better than packaged beer from afar.* On this visit, the staff ran out of clean glasses and switched to plastic cups. Generally that doesn't happen but hopefully it won't become a trend.* The food menu caters well for vegetarians and fairly well for vegans.* No info is provided on social and environmental impact (e.g., food sourcing, staff benefits, etc.)* According to Glassdoor, a server/bartender earns around $16/hr plus around $10/hr in tips.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "James K.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great!  I only had one day in Berkeley and I'm glad I spent a couple of hours here in the afternoon.  The beer selection and menu choices were excellent I sat at the bar, so maybe that was why the service was also excellent.  The upcoming lineup of live events made me want to move to Berkeley!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Mark J.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: Friday night and we were looking for a spot that had TVs to watch SF Giants clinch the Wild West for the 2021 season. This spot was perfect for what we were looking for and served up some burgers and appetizers. They had an assortment of beers on tap as well.I ordered the barbecue bacon burger and my gf had the avovado burger .  We also ordered some  wings for appetizers. The wings came out and I must I was very disappointed. They were on the smaller size and just a huge miss.But the burgers were on hit and so were the thin cut fries. Burgers were very filling and served ona sesame bun. My barbecue burger had your standard tomatoe, pickle, lettuce, and onion between two buns but the bacon and sweet tasting barbecue sauce were on hit.Cornerstone is also a concert venue spot just about every weekend. So check out their concert listing. Be prepared to show your vaccine card upon entering or you won't be able to dine at the tables. Another thing, to order anything we had to make line and put in our order at the front counter. No biggie, the line went fairly quick. Dining area is very spacious and there's even a back patio with a fire grill to enjoy.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Denis A.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: This place will get plenty of business, as it's pretty much the only place around with a full bar and live entertainment.  I, however, am not one bit impressed.  The management and bar staff are not one bit attentive.  I came in to see if anything had changed since my last visit.  Big mistake.  The place is clean and big, wait staff sucks as does the food.  Not sure how else to describe a boring, bland place.  It's like a meat packing place.  Line 'em up, shoot them between the eyes, and move on...
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Annei P.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: A venue that does not care for their patrons or follow city requirements during Covid. If you want to see what I'm talking about, check out the YouTube clips of Amigo The Devil from a few weeks back. The floor was PACKED without a mask in site (required per the city at this point), and there were even people crowd surfing! They didn't confirm proof of vax or negative test for a bunch of people in front of us in line. You want to potentially get sick? Attend a show at Cornerstone...
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "SJ V.", "AuthorLocation": "San Jose, CA"}

ReviewContent: Bought tix for the disco party tonight. It was clear they oversold - the event started at 9:30 and the line was a 50+ minute wait until 11pm. Staff working the event were extremely rude (and it's evident this isn't a one time thing.. read the recent negative reviews). Have had bad experiences here but this is by far the worst. Would never recommend.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Phil F.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Paul Michael had no reason to not let us in. It was ridiculous. We had tickets. Worst bar experience.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Abbi B.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: I had for the first time visited this establishment this past weekend for a show & on their website it indicated you need to show proof of a negative test atleast 72 hours prior or proof of vaccinations. Well once we arrived & got checked in they weren't asking for anyone's test results I had got tested before the show & had proof of negative results. On Monday after the weekend symptoms started to pop up & indeed had tested positive for Covid. My friend as well tested positive. I would just like to bring it up to their attention to actually follow their own guidelines & for patrons visiting to be extra careful in this environment this sickness is by far the worse my body has encountered! Everyone stay safe & healthy!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Eliza J.", "AuthorLocation": "San Jose, CA"}

ReviewContent: Before COVID, we were always greeted and seated by servers. We'd come here with friends for drinks and their Big Ass Chocolate Cake.This time around, we went on a Friday night, walked in and grabbed a table ourselves. There were only 2 servers walking around, both were maskless, didn't say a word to us or ask if we needed anything. We walked up to the bar to order our drinks and a slice of cake.Drinks were great as usual, but as soon as I took that first bite of the cake I felt something plasticky. We showed the server the piece of plastic (picture attached), she didn't say much, took the cake back and sent out another slice.We've definitely had better experiences here before COVID, still shocked that neither of the servers were wearing masks or gloves. Only 2 of the 3 bartenders had masks on.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Janet F.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: came in and waited for a bit with no servers. Asked if we can see the menu, then we were motioned to the bar, and waited a bit, still no one came to serve us...
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Jennifer H.", "AuthorLocation": "Southside, Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Alex, is the reason why I keep coming back. All the staff is cool, but Alex I feel like is exceptional and really cares about his job (not that anyone there doesn't...they all cool). I will always be back! Thank you all!!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Paige M.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: Always a good outing at cornerstone. Whether you want a semi quiet place for brunch and sports, indoor or outdoor seating, a concert in their attached space, or a fun weekend DJ with a little space to dance at your table with friends, Cornerstone comes through. Their food and drink selections are expansive - surprising fact: check out their meat and cheese boards, customize it yourself.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Wendy N.", "AuthorLocation": "Emeryville, CA"}

ReviewContent: So KIPS closed and I swear this became the new go to spot for drinks (at least for me and my friends).This one is for Jerome and Jerome only! Homie always made my drinks here and whatever he put in it had me drunk out of my mind. My go-to drinks: AMF (depending on how bad you want to spiral), Tequila Sunrise or Paloma, Whisky Sours or Patron shots (or all of this combined in one night). - Whatever I ordered was from Jerome (who legit is my fav bartender here) & had me dancing all night.My friends and I used to come on Thursday nights and the line would just be sooooo long to get in. I swear we've waited at least an hour and a half in line. Beware: There are security guards that will try to hit on you. My boyfriend was not having it. (Even though it could have gotten me to the front of the line.)It's actually really fun inside depending on what day you go. There's live music with DJs (yes they play all the bangers. from throwbacks to new music. it's lit). There's high tables, booths, and an outdoor patio.I couldn't tell you much about the day time scene or the food. I don't come to cornerstone for that.I promise, every time I've been here it's been messy (in a good way, some would say)
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Rhea A.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: Open during covid.  Large bar can seat 50 and large patio can accommodate 30. Definitely not a dive bar. Large selection of beer and wine. Food:  typical basic fast food available.  We ordered fries, nuggets, yam fries, charcuterie, fried macaroni balls, cauliflower.  Food came out hot. Also ordered slices of cake, waffles with whipped cream and berries on top. Ambiance:  nice clean bar. Back patio has fireplaces to keep people warm.  Long benches available for casual seating. Umbrellas available if sunny.  Can hold concert. Hope after covid they will have them again.  Will card everyone.  Make sure you bring id, even if you are +30 +50 years old.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Laurra H.", "AuthorLocation": "East Oakland, Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: The bartender during the day is literally the worst. Walked in and asked if we could have audio for the sports game that was on the TV (we were the only people inside) and he gave so much attitude and said we would rather have music in the background. Despite us ordering drinks and food and pleading he continued to give attitude and refuse. I really don't understand how you could be a sports bar and not turn on audio or at least give a good reason. The bartender always gives attitude. Avoid
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Nojan K.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: NEW FAVORITE STUDY SPOT!!!!!! We recently came here during finals week and snagged a table outside on the great patio. We all had local beer and cider on tap, ALL GREAT! They had great wifi and the vibes were immaculate. And can we talk about the music selection!?!? A VIBE!  Love coming here! Check it out for a great drink!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Eloisa M.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: We came here for lunch on Saturday afternoon. We've ordered the avocado burger and the cornerstone burger at the bar. Also got some sodas and a small beer. They have a nice selection of beers but we had to drive that day. They have nice outdoor seating and inside a lot of TVs to watch a game. Burgers arrived promptly with side of fries for me and sweet potato fries for my wife.  Burgers were great, I've never had the combination of pulled pork and a patty, but really liked. Avocado burger and the fries were also really good. Staff was really friendly and patient while we took our time with the menu. Will give it another try in the future.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Andreas G.", "AuthorLocation": "Sunnyvale, CA"}

ReviewContent: Thursday nights at cornerstone is where it's at. Security holds it down extremely well and the bar works nonstop; making great drinks. We talked to Alex and Jaz for awhile and they were super nice and make great chat.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Trevor M.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: Went there last night to celebrate graduating and can I say that the "security" SUCKS. First when arriving security let some little girl in with simply a picture of her ID and "proof" of her showing videos of herself drinking... good job on letting underage kids in.Second, around 12/1am my boyfriend and I were going to the bar to get drinks when a ghetto couple approached us WITH SECURITY, and accused my boyfriend (a very shy and respectful guy) of blatantly grabbing her ass and security WITHOUT QUESTION, told me and my boyfriend we have to leave. This couple was aggressive and violent yet me and my boyfriend were kicked out. This place needs better management. They hire whatever bum they can as security considering the events of last night. Hesitant to ever go back to this place. Such a shame a good night ended like this.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Tatianna A.", "AuthorLocation": "Anaheim, CA"}

ReviewContent: My pup and I were regulars here for years since Cornerstone opened! He loves it so much that he tries to dart in in whenever we walk by! Great beer selection, *awesome* staff, and a spacious and fun atmosphere. It has an overall great vibe and it's been my go-to spot to chill with friends, or just grab some lunch and work. Highly recommended if you're looking for a cool spot downtown, and especially if you're looking for a pup friendly place!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Aniket K.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Not only does cornerstone have great food, but the ambiance and workers are phenomenal as well. Great service and good music to dance to on a Friday/ Saturday night in a semi open area to keep distance during these unprecedented times. Plenty of Rotating beers on tap to choose from along with a wide range of spirits as well. Highly recommend deviled eggs and a cheeseburgers with grilled onions and bacon
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Bianca G.", "AuthorLocation": "Laurel Heights, San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: What a great place and it gave us a shed of normalcy again. My husband and I were looking for a place with music, outdoor dining and drinks. My friend recommended Cornerstone. I called ahead to get an idea of the vibe and spoke to a gentleman named Mendoza. He told us he would take care of us and he did. We showed up right before the time we were told it would get crowded. We had a table outside near the fire pits, in ear shot of the DJ. It was awesome. The food was great, drinks were yummy and strong ( for me but I'm a cheap date My husband said they were perfect). Delicious German beer that my husband loved. Staff came around often to check on guests. As the night went on the crowds got bigger. All wearing masks. I'm glad we stayed outside, inside was a bit too crowded for me as the night went on inside, but outside remained perfect. But it made me happy to see people dancing inside. I was worried this was another club like atmosphere full of 20-30somethings and we would look out of place, but not at all. People of all ages were present ( we are in our 40's). The DJ played music from 90's Era to present..Bar tenders were attentive. It was all around great business. Can't wait to go back. We were told live music will begin again soon. Thanks to Mendoza and the entire staff for giving my husband and I the first real date night we have had since the Pandemic started.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Aimee P.", "AuthorLocation": "Alameda, CA"}

ReviewContent: Best vodka crans in the Bay Area. Cornerstone? More like corner home. They give you free glowstick necklaces, which are super cool and you can take them home.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Danielle S.", "AuthorLocation": "Southside, Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: this place actually sucks. the staff is beyond rude and the drinks are weak. the only reason this place is packed is because it is the only bar open during covid. if you want to be met with hostility for absolutely no reason at all, hop in the 3 hour line at cornerstone and you will get what you came for
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Siena L.", "AuthorLocation": "Belvedere Tiburon, Tiburon, CA"}

ReviewContent: The bouncer MIGUEL was extremely aggressive towards me and my girl friends. While waiting in line we asked if we could use the restroom. He told us if we wanted to use the restroom we had to give him all our cellphones. First of all definitely illegal and unnecessary but we agreed anyways. We took less than 10 minutes and returned. We asked for our phones back and he proceeded to lie that he gave our property away to a different group of girls. Naturally reacted upset because  we thought he gave our phones away and did not think the situation was funny. When my friend expressed that she did not think his behavior was appropriate, he raised his voice at us and we walked away back to our place in line. As we approached the front, Miguel informed us that he would not allow my friend who "talked back" at him in but would allow the rest of us in. I cannot express the gravity of disgusting toxic masculinity this tiny pathetic excuse of a man presented. Did not feel safe here as a woman
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Erica M.", "AuthorLocation": "Pomona, CA"}

ReviewContent: This bar doesn't even deserve 1 star. They prey on college kids because there is no where else to go out during covid, and they use this to their advantage. The line to get in frequently exceeds 2 hours and once you do get in you are met with hostility and animosity. After waiting for over 30 minutes to get a drink, the bar tenders threaten to kick you out if you so much as ask to order French fries- because there are not enough bartenders to meet the demand and so they are all in terrible moods and take it out on their customers. Also- circling back to taking advantage of their customers, cornerstone includes gratuity in the checks when their demeanor and treatment of human beings is far below what should be socially acceptable. Most importantly- kips if you are reading this please reopen.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Yoko S.", "AuthorLocation": "Elmwood, Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Horrible bouncers- do not know how to deal with a line and people during COVID. Rude staff. Not cute!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Taylor R.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Only giving this 1 star because the bar tenders are super rude and aggressive but what can you expect working at a college bar.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Jennifer M.", "AuthorLocation": "Beverly Hills, CA"}

ReviewContent: The bouncers at this bar were EXTREMELY aggressive and punched a friend across the face when he wasn't looking because he wanted to retrieve an item after leaving. They then proceeded to chase us and threaten us when we got mad at their actions, while the more rational employees tried to hold back the aggressive ones back. I'm shocked they acted like that and wish I could give this bar negative reviews.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Amrit P.", "AuthorLocation": "University City, San Diego, CA"}

ReviewContent: They made me hate this place Service 0 ..bad management .. customer service 0 That was a waste of time..
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Driss F.", "AuthorLocation": "Downtown Berkeley, Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: I absolutely love this bar! We went with a few classmates after a long exam week and they had a massive and spacious indoor seating area (while still maintaining social distancing and safe covid rules). The staff was wonderful and I chatted with one of the bar tenders for a while about a new matcha tequila drink he put on the menu (was strong but tasty if you like matcha!). Overall the food is pretty simple bar food, (with vegetarian tenders!!!! :) but they had a nice selection of cocktails and beers as well. I'm looking forward to experiencing this great space post covid!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Savanah L.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: The workers were seriously rude. One person at the front told us to seat ourselves then another dude yelled at us in a really condescending way. Server was fine, food was decent but seemed like it had been left out for a while before they gave it to us. Found a hair in the nachos. Beer was warm. Also got a lot of strange looks from what seemed to be the "regulars" there - just a strange/judge mental vibe that is difficult to describe. Overall not a great experience and won't be back again!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Gabi P.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Had a couple of hours to kill and decided to have a few drinks here. They have nice patio in the back, that's decently sized and dog-friendly. They offer both cocktails and beers, albeit somewhat of a limited draft list. For the beers, they offer both 10oz, 16oz, and pitchers that were well-priced. Cocktails were available for about $10. You can also try ordering cocktails off-the-menu, but they weren't able to make some of our requests as they have limited mixing ingredients.Saw a table next to us who ordered a burger that definitely had me salivating and would need to try it next time I'm here.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Jonathan C.", "AuthorLocation": "San Mateo, CA"}

ReviewContent: Large groups eating indoors without wearing masks. What could go wrong. Two stars because it used to be a good place, but this is unacceptable.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "hari m.", "AuthorLocation": "Albany, CA"}

ReviewContent: Workers were rude and dismissive - not a BIPOC friendly place. Way too many people packed in there
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Christopher H.", "AuthorLocation": "San Pablo, CA"}

ReviewContent: They will rob you by refusing to refund tickets to show that was canceled due to a pandemic.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Navine K.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: There kitchen is never open.Update, just got food from there, it tasted really bad
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Corvo C.", "AuthorLocation": "Downtown Berkeley, Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: My partner and I frequent this spot for its beer selection, great little veggie tenders, soup + salads, and its patio for our pup!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Ali O.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great food, music and beer selection! What more could you need? Plus outside seating in back. They took excellent care of us& the place is SUPER clean& spotless. Thank you! We will be back very soon!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Joren C.", "AuthorLocation": "Richmond, CA"}

ReviewContent: First timer,  came on a Hot afternoon. Nice set up outside during covid, we tried a few beers on tap. Interesting the waitress told us we wouldn't like a certain beer lol I did realize they have regulars who get more attention. I would say it was ok. It was so hot the beer was hot in no time, and the food wasn't bad. I would say the men were more attentive to our table than the woman. I would try it again maybe...
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "LPthang S.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: This place is a good music venue right near BART. I found parking right in front on a Saturday night for Koo Koo Kangaroo. The venue is pretty spacious. I ordered soup before the show and the price was reasonable and the service was fine. The sound here is really good as well and since the show had kids and adults it didn't feel over crowded. There was enough room to dance and move around the venue as you come and go as you please. Not sure what else to say other than, I probably would come back here to see another band. I may even have more than soup. This is a great addition to downtown Berkeley.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Amy J.", "AuthorLocation": "Pleasanton, CA"}

ReviewContent: I came here once. There was a caucasian Male with a beard and glasses that was really rude to me.  He thought I worked their for some reason because when I asked for a coke he filled it up with a small plastic cup. He said the glass cups are for guest only. I am thinking even if worked there. People should have some respect anyways. Last experience I will have here.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Anti M.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: The bar is cool! A bit bigger and commercial looking but sleek. Great selection of beer with nice outdoor patio making for a prime spot for meetups with friends and colleagues. I came here for the first time for a show and their performances feature some awesome people! From underground hip hop to rock shows, this is like the Ace of Spades of Berkeley! I'm constantly checking their list of performers and am always impressed. I saw People Under the Stairs here which is one the best shows I've been to. Cool crowd and great energy! If you came here to grab a drink, and didn't know there was a stage in back, you'd never know! Very good sound insulation to where conversations don't get overpowered by noise! Great spot, check it out!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Antonio S.", "AuthorLocation": "Concord, CA"}

ReviewContent: Not a trust worthy establishment. Significant fraudulent transactions made on my credit card while it was in there care. After months of waiting and several conversations with the managers, I'm still out almost $100 dollars.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Matthew A.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: I've come here many times before, usually to eat a snack before seeing a concert here. As a concert venue, it is one of my favorites in the Bay Area. It is conveniently located near BART, has an attached restaurant for ease of eating, and it's small for a close view of the artists playing. Food: I've gotten the vegetarian tenders, brussel sprouts, fries, the vegetarian shepherd's pie, and the big ass chocolate cake. All of which have been pretty good food at reasonable prices. I would recommend any of it. Their beer and cider selection is also pretty decent. My friends also love the apple berry tart here. Service:Each time I've come, the servers and staff have always been super nice to interact with. Depending on the time of day, it is either self seat or you see the hostess. TL;DR - great music venue in Berkeley with a lovely attached restaurant
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Jenny T.", "AuthorLocation": "Sunnyvale, CA"}

ReviewContent: This is an awesome venue. I've never been to a place like this. The front of the house is a full bar with food and drinks. The back is a music venue. It's nice that you can take a break from the venue and chill in the dining area to get some fresh air. There's also a nice little outdoor patio to chill at. I only came here for a concert while I was visiting California but if I lived there, this would be one of my favorite venues for sure.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Courtney S.", "AuthorLocation": "Portland, OR"}

ReviewContent: We came in there last night to grab a couple of drinks & a bite before the show. Michelle was AWESOME!!  We had the BEST customer service from her. She recommended the pulled pork sandwich & it was DELICIOUS.  She was having some issues with another customer & she handled it like a BOSS. VERY professional, VERY sweet. Because of MICHELLE & her service we will definitely be back. THANKS Michelle!! :)
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Lia F.", "AuthorLocation": "South Lake Tahoe, CA"}

ReviewContent: Went to see a friend's band as a fundraiser last month, but didn't partake of the food service. Props to the place for extending their hospitality for a fundraiser, but the concert venue itself has very little seating. If you're looking to sit, you should head upstairs where there are bar stools and a couple couches. You may need to barter or battle for them.Since my preferred adult beverage is bourbon, there was little choice at the bar, but it was a decent pour and the bartenders were friendly despite being slammed by the large crowd.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "M Lisa R.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: I came here to hear a band and have dinner beforehand.  It took a while to get acknowledged once we were seated - the staff was slammed pre-show, so we  were starting to look at where else we might eat when Marissa came up and apologized for the wait.
