From then on things went well - service from that point on was excellent. I had  ribs.  I would have liked a less sweet sauce but that's a matter of taste- the ribs were cooked perfectly.  Our beers were high-quality drafts and the lines were clean.  I liked the Cole slaw that came with my ribs.  More of a vinegar than mayo dressing.My partner really liked her tri-tip with French dip sandwich and her sweet potato fries were really tasty.The place feels impersonal and sterile - it's a big room, but I'd definitely return.  As a live music venue- sound was pretty good and the room is a nice size.  Big enough to hold a fair number of people but nobody is very far from the stage.  I'd definitely come back to see other acts there.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Kurt R.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Last night was our first time coming here.  We decided to grab a bite to eat before our friends went on stage with their band.  Our server was OK.  She brought us menus within a minute of us sitting down and took our order quickly.  After our food came out (brought out by someone else), she was a little hard to flag down but we were not neglected.  Our food came out less than 5 minutes after we ordered which was surprising.  We shared Brussels sprouts that came with a *delicious* dipping sauce.  The sprouts arrived piping hot and perfectly cooked.  They were excellent and the highlight of what we ordered. The pretzel was OK.  There wasn't a lot of flavor (was missing the salt) but it was soft and fresh.  The olives were good but the serving was enormous for 2 people.  The prosciutto was good, came with mustards, cornichon pickles and a few slices of bread.  The prosciutto was sliced thicker than I like but it was good.   I love the vibe of this place.  It was easy to walk around and mingle with others we knew there.  The food was good.  The beer was flowing.  The concert we came to see was good.  It was $5 cash to get in.  Between Mr and myself, we had $7 in cash and the girl smiled and waved us in.  Thank you!  The sound was good although the vocals were really hard to hear.  This was a fun place and we will come back again.  It would be a fun place to come to celebrate a birthday with a group or even come for a casual date night.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Mrs. M.", "AuthorLocation": "Gig Harbor, WA"}

ReviewContent: Excellent food at a reasonable price, served quickly, and no waiting. Plus a nice venue. Pretty much perfect.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Dan O.", "AuthorLocation": "Kensington, CA"}

ReviewContent: This was my first time here and I'd love to come back and try the food and the drinks as I was only here for 60 minutes in the concert venue to see my friends perform.  I had to attend another concert the same night at almost the same time so this was my second stop for the night.  I decided to park my car near Cornerstone and take Uber to the first concert and Uber back to Cornerstone so I wouldn't have to find parking.I was lucky to find a parking spot about 1/2 a block away on Shattuck!  Talk about Parking Karma!  Then when I came back on Uber to Cornerstone, I went to the box office on Durant and the doors were locked and the box office was closed at 11 pm!  The sign on the box office said to enter the concert venue through the restaurant.  The host at the restaurant tried to contact the concert venue but no one answered so he finally decided to let me walk through to the concert venue but put a wristband on me to indicate I was of drinking age, thank you very much!Unfortunately, time was running out and I just wanted to watch my friends perform so at the entrance to the concert venue, I was told there was only 30 minutes left to the show and that they would only charge me $10.  Originally the cover charge was $15 at the door and $12 in advance but when you added the fees, it would cost $16.72, more than the door price.  So I got to see the last hour of my friends' performance and the concert venue was intimate and there was room for dancing!  It was standing room only; however, I didn't mind.  I went straight up to the front to take photos and videos!  There's a bar in the rear but since the show was already on, I didn't get a chance to try any of their beers.  But I hope to the next time I'm here!  The sound system was awesome and my friends looked great on that ginormous stage!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Karen W.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: This is my favorite spot to get drinks with friends when in Berkeley. You can't beat the huge beer selection on tap, trendy interior, and fireplaces outside. The bartenders here are very friendly and generous with their tastings. There are also very few places I've found that make as good of mocktails as they do here.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Patty B.", "AuthorLocation": "Lafayette, CA"}

ReviewContent: I like this little concert hall. Just saw a Tom Petty tribute band and had a really good time. The place isn't too large and so no matter where you're standing you have a great view.The sound was just fine and not overpowering.Next time I'm going to skip the restaurant because the food was nasty. The beer was fairly good though and the service wasn't bad.  My partner had a Cobb salad with undercooked bacon on it and I had a avocado burger with cold fries and extra grease.Not much seating in the hall - it's basically GA standing room only. Several tabs are available at the back of the hall or you can step out to the restaurant and order from their large list of beers.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Paul C.", "AuthorLocation": "Sacramento, CA"}

ReviewContent: First time here for New Years Eve 2020. They have a music venue attached to the restaurant. Amazing dishes and they are customizable. Service was great made us feel like royalty. I would highly recommend this place for anyone even veggies dishes too
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Jason C.", "AuthorLocation": "Los Angeles, CA"}

ReviewContent: I haven't eaten at the restaurant here, but I want to.  The music venue is quirky.  It feels half-finished.  Actually, it reminds me of the Hollywood venue in the CHiPs episode in which Ponch is the singer in a new-wave band, and there's a punk band that's up to no good, because in the world of CHiPs, disco and new wave are good, but punk is bad.My dear friend Brenda (RIP) and I had tickets to see Agent Orange here in 2017, but she died a few weeks before the show.  I went with my brother, and it was emotional for many reasons.  It was a great show, and we came to see the English Beat the following year, and that show was even better.The floor is where all the action is, but the view from upstairs is pretty good, and you're not that far from the stage.  I was surprised that bands as big as Agent Orange and the English Beat still played in venues this small, but I'm glad they do.If someone offers you a free ticket to see someone here, take it.  Sharpen your elbows, be prepared to pay cash for old-school T-shirts and CDs, and enjoy yourself.  Don't get drunk and start a fight.  I saw someone do that during a song.  That was a faux pas.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "John S.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: I finally had the chance to come here after my husband's been raving about this place for the past few months. I must say I was impressed. We came Saturday night during the 49ers game so this made for a really fun environment. We had drinks and great food. Also, service was great all around. I ordered a avocado burger for dinner and deviled eggs for appetizer. The deviled eggs were just ok they gave only 3 pieces which is really odd to me since when you cut 2 eggs in have you get 4 pieces but I digress lol. The burger was cooked exactly how I like it and the fries were great too. They are a tad pricey in my opinion for appetizers but pricing is somewhat fair for entrees. Either way, I will definitely be back.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Arielle B.", "AuthorLocation": "San Leandro, CA"}

ReviewContent: This place became our spot! We come here on Saturday nights and we always have a great time. The ambiance flows between being chill and energizing, super welcoming with a lot to offer. Spacious seating everywhere, such a large lounge! Full bar, firepit patio, game room that doubles as a dance and concert room. The bartenders are skilled and they, plus the servers, are very attentive and quick. I love to invite people here and they are never disappointed! P.S. Is there anyway to install a pool table somewhere?? Pretty please??
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Roze T.", "AuthorLocation": "San Diego, CA"}

ReviewContent: So I remember when this place used to be called Thalassa and now it's something totally different! But I love the upgrades made. It's like a super sports bar with a concert area in back with an outdoor seating area and fire pits. So i didn't get anything to eat here nor do I know if they have food but I most certainly got drinks. It was one of those nights after hours of mindless drinking and you kind of want to keep the night going at a slower pace. I decided to check this local Berkeley bar out with a few friends to see how it changed. I love it! The bar fits the demographic as it caters to the 21+ UC Berkeley crowd roaming around to find a good place to watch the Cal Bears. Booming with energy I decided to take a seat at the very large bar and knock back a couple of cocktails. I went with the Moscow Mule which is one of my favorites. It was strong but just what I needed. You can always ask a bar tender to add more mixer to a drink but you can't always get them to make it stronger. So I appreciated the kick! Lined with flat screen tv's, colorful bar and spacious seating it was right what we needed. If you're in the downtown Berkeley area and you want a good sports bar this is a cool place to hangout
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Sanovia J.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: Above average burger spot if you want to be fancy.Fries are good, but it's slightly overpriced.They changed their menu recently and lost the Kimchi burger (notice my biases towards asian tiered dishes)
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Kim A.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Do you have that time to listen to me whine?  As a kid I grew up in the East Bay I remember when this place was a pool hall, and I got out hustled for a pair of my jordans. Kidding...kidding? This used to be a great place that I used to go play pool at. Now...it's a great selection of an inexpensive, hipster, ambient  Plentiful plethora of food, drinks, and music. I have come to see a bunch of punk rock shows here, and I do love reggae so I might be back for that... One thing I have to say is that the sound here is top notch 1 of the best sound systems I have ever listened too.  They have a spacious bar and various screens so you can find yourself coming chillin for sporting events and sleek and sexy patio seating that's in the back, I'd reccomended this place for groups.  One of my friends had his bachelor party start here and we had a great time.... I don't quite remember when we finished. Anyways if you're stopping by at the bookstore or just craving a good night cap this is the place to be.  I have to come back and try their food.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Michael R.", "AuthorLocation": "San Jose, CA"}

ReviewContent: We came here to kill some time before dinner.  Ordered some cocktails off the happy hour menu.  The bartender was super sweet and attentive.  I've never been to a bar where I actually got a choice of vodka -- so I didn't know how to respond.  :) She proceeded to give the group her drink recommendations and share her vast knowledge on the drinks. It was quite educational and fun!  She also gave us a small sample of mezcal.  Super tasty and smooth.  Sorry we had to only limit our stay to 1 drink.  Next time.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Em M.", "AuthorLocation": "Dixon, CA"}

ReviewContent: Went with two friends on Saturday October 26. One friend ordered a vodka cranberry from the female bartender behind the bar, she gave us back a glass of pure cranberry juice (you could tell just from looking at it). We all took sips and said this is definitely just pure cranberry juice. My friend politely asked the bartender who made it if she maybe forgot to add the shot of alcohol into it and the bartender snapped back "i put an ounce and a half in it". I took the drink over to the guy bartender with a goatee and asked him to try it, he then confirmed that it definitely was just pure cranberry juice, and he made us a new one.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Hana A.", "AuthorLocation": "Alamo, CA"}

ReviewContent: This place is the perfect place to have a cozy drink with a date or to hang out with friends! The food, beverages, atmosphere, and service are excellent!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Tami P.", "AuthorLocation": "Anderson, IN"}

ReviewContent: This place is so the vibe!! I went out with my best friend to get drinks and have some fun, it was the perfect place!! We had great service because the bartender Michelle is so friendly and an awesome person!! Michelle made our Tammy's Margaritas to perfection!! She is the reason why we are definitely coming back!!!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Athena G.", "AuthorLocation": "Roseville, CA"}

ReviewContent: Food is horrible. No customer service. Not going back. As if they decided yo get the food for our office party at Pak and Save and forgot to heat them properly. Overpriced - not worth it for having an office event.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Daisy L.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Had not been here after it was revamped & the name changed.. of course, it's amazing. Very friendly & relaxed environment, DJ - mixing it up with the tunes... very inviting. Beer, Vodka Tonics, Margaritas, Red Bulls & Tequila - wide range of drinks!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Esmee D.", "AuthorLocation": "Antioch, CA"}

ReviewContent: I had a very bad experience at Cornerstone during a private event. My friend and I, who are both guys, were using the restroom and we entered the same stall as we both just needed to pee and the bathroom was very crowded. As we left the stall after going pee, a man who was in a regular black T-shirt grabbed my friend by the shoulder and accused us of doing drugs or having sex in the bathroom. We had only been in there for about 30 seconds and were completely sober. We were not aware that you could not go into a stall together. He told us that he worked there and that we needed to leave after asking us if we were "gay or something."  I told him that I wanted to speak to a manager because the way we were being treated was very wrong. Me and my friend are not gay, however there would be nothing wrong with it if we were. We waited for 20 minutes until the manager can over to see us. Her name was Susan or Suzanne. She refused to provide me with her last name so that I could follow up about this issue but instead told me I could talk to her attorney. I asked for her attorneys contact info or name and she refused to provide it. This is just bad business to not be open with the customer. She then instructed the security guards "that they need to leave" and before I knew it I was being grabbed by the neck and shoulders by a huge security guard and roughly dragged. One of my shoes came off during this and my ankle was twisted. I had not said anything rude, and was just trying to work out the situation in a calm way. I was completely sober as I am not 21 and my friend and I were treated with blatant disrespect and a lack of safety sense. It was completely uncalled for to kick us out because we might have been "gay or something" and then to have security drag us out. If you want to be treated with respect or equality do not go to cornerstone in Berkeley. There are plenty of better clubs and restaurants that treat their customers with basic dignity.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Aiden K.", "AuthorLocation": "East Roseville Parkway, Roseville, CA"}

ReviewContent: Didn't try the food, but the selection is great & you cannot beat the happy hour! Plus the concert venue is intement with a superb layout. A worthy spot in classic Berkeley.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Melissa B.", "AuthorLocation": "Woodinville, WA"}

ReviewContent: Top notch music venue. I have been to a handful of shows here and they have all been good experiences. They have a huge selection of beers on tap as well!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Matt B.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: Burgers are so good! Fries are great especially with ranch! great lunch spot, service is fast and employees are so nice!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Debra D.", "AuthorLocation": "Richmond, CA"}

ReviewContent: We had a great time seeing the Wailers this past weekend! The food was good, although it's mainly appetizers.  One can choose to sit outside, on a couch, at the bar, many places to sit.  The concert area was large enough to dance, but not to big and we could see the performance up close. They don't have chairs in the concert area, well, about 4 tables and a few high chairs throughout.  I think a few more chairs and tables downstairs would be a good idea.  Also we almost missed the main act because our tickets said 8:30.  But, the headliner was at 10:30, we were just about to leave when we saw a sign telling us the Wailers are performing at 10:30. The blood orange drink was very good!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Dina B.", "AuthorLocation": "Walnut Creek, CA"}

ReviewContent: Stopped here for some drinks, appetizers and dinner while hanging out in Berkeley. They had a great selection of drinks: beers, ciders, cocktails, iced tea, etc. Our server, Justin, was very attentive, helpful, and fun to talk to! The appetizers were all delicious. My favorite was the vegetarian chicken tenders which came with three different types of dipping sauces (chipotle, barbecue, and ranch). They were some of the best tasting fake chicken that I've ever tried. The brussel sprouts, cheese board and pork belly nachos were also really yummy! I decided to try out the tofu and avocado sandwich for my main meal, and I was not disappointed. The tofu was well-seasoned and had a great chewy tofu texture. I was really impressed that this place had an all-veggie main course that wasn't just a veggie burger. I'd definitely come back here for drinks, food, live music or corn hole!!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Lauryn R.", "AuthorLocation": "San Mateo, CA"}

ReviewContent: Quick & friendly service...nice tap beer selection...tasty and healthy comfort food.  Easy dinner drop-in.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "John K.", "AuthorLocation": "Folsom, CA"}

ReviewContent: Crap agist bored looking bartenders and music sux. Music too loud for being so sh*t. Not recommended.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "D S.", "AuthorLocation": "Houston, TX"}

ReviewContent: Came in at noon Saturday 7/27/19 ordered a scratch margarita and a rye and ginger ale. The pours were either extremely light or the bottles were watered. I took the drinks to the bartender saying that the pour was light and he said that not only were they not light but that he had poured double shots..  In a standard highball glass my wife and I would have noticed. I hate being cheated and I hate being lied to.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Brandon J.", "AuthorLocation": "Seattle, WA"}

ReviewContent: Food is awesome! Great lunch specials too! I have only been here during lunch but I definitely want to come to see how the nightlife is. Staff is also very nice!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Camille F.", "AuthorLocation": "Wailuku, HI"}

ReviewContent: Great place! Big and spacious, nice wood, charming staff, fun crowd.  They served me an old fashioned in a wine tumbler. Other than that, this place was a win.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Adam O.", "AuthorLocation": "Richmond, CA"}

ReviewContent: Love that they have free ping pong and cornhole in the back. It wasn't super busy on a Friday night so it was perfect for our group of 6 to play a variety of games and no wait for drinks!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Anh Thu P.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: Looks like a great venue for music, but I was really disappointed by the sound quality. I saw Jamila Woods here in June and could barely hear her angelic vocals over the instruments. We all left with a headache.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Neda S.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: First time here even though I've walked by it for months. Reasonable prices on beer esp. for this area. Good food and  delicious pickles!  super cool bartender who was on point and he was the only one working. This will be my new go to spot. I can't wait to come back for happy hour.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "J J.", "AuthorLocation": "Alameda, CA"}

ReviewContent: Best lunch in the area! Excellent WiFi, great place to work. Especially love the $5 burger and house salad, oh! and the hummus plate! One of the few places that has sour beer on tap.  This is my go-to place for lunch/work afternoons in Berkeley.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "M W.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: I really like it here. Not uppity in a sense, classy, but you can dress down if so desire. They usually have live music, and wormhole (rave/edm) will host thier parties here! The food was delicious!!! There bean sauce was bomb! My fiancé and I were happy :)
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Ari C.", "AuthorLocation": "Antioch, CA"}

ReviewContent: Amazing selection of local beers. Great for large groups. Any vegetarians/vegans out there have to try the vegetarian tenders. They are so close to real chicken it's amazing! Even had the meat eaters fooled! Definitely recommend this place for beers with friends.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Jillian H.", "AuthorLocation": "Uniondale, NY"}

ReviewContent: They wouldn't accept a legit ID card after we took a Lyft got excited to drink at a new place and everything. We are almost 25 too. Do not recommend unless you have multiple forms of ID.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Randy L.", "AuthorLocation": "Downtown Berkeley, Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Steven waited on us and was super nice with lots of good tips for this area. Delicious food and brews! Wish I could have seen a show here. Great atmosphere! Cali Squeeze and I could really enjoy each other.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Chrissy C.", "AuthorLocation": "Saint Louis, MO"}

ReviewContent: We came here for a graduation celebration lunch and it was perfect for a large group! It was super empty on a Monday afternoon which was great, and our group was able to get seated at a large high table. There is a large beer selection which everyone enjoyed, and everyone was able to get something that they enjoyed. I shared the Kale & Butternut Squash Salad and the Cornerstone Burger. I definitely would have gotten tired of the flavor of both dishes if I had to eat the whole thing, so I'm satisfied with going half and half. The salad was very refreshing and I love the mix of all the veggies (kale, romaine, edamame, cauliflower) and the additions of the goat cheese, almond and squash were great. Everything was diced up so every bite included all of these items. The burger was heavy but delicious. The mac 'n cheese was a great addition and helped lessen the smoky and barbecue flavor of the burger. It looks like there is live music that happens which I wish was going on, there is corn hole to play, lots of TVs playing different games, and it is located in a convenient spot in Berkeley! Once the food was dropped off at our table, the waiter never came to check in on us so waters weren't refilled and we had to flag someone down to get more condiments (hot sauce, ranch. etc.). Overall, great graduation celebration place!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Anna B.", "AuthorLocation": "San Diego, CA"}

ReviewContent: It's been a few years since we have seen this place open up. I've always wanted to check it out but now that we have kids, I am all too aware of pleated that are not kid friendly. It's also difficult to find a place where you can enjoy a meal with a toddler and 1 year old in tow. I'm just super glad we gave it a shot, the food was great, service was exceptional and it was both dog and kid friendly. I wish and hope that this place stays in business as it's centrally located, has a great food menu, and is a place where we can come back to! Thanks for the great experience.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Nicole S.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: Came here on a Saturday night, and while the music venue was packed, the bar was fairly empty. This was great because we got to hear good music playing but going to the bar was simple and we kept the drinks flowing. Plenty of beers to choose from and the fact that we could do pitchers was awesome! Great place, wouldn't mind coming to watch a show here too....save that for next time!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Andrew M.", "AuthorLocation": "Fremont, CA"}

ReviewContent: The bartenders in the live-music area were being really jerks to my friend. Even though at the entrance to the bar, we were all asked for our ID and given wrist bands to drink, for some reason the bartender did not want to give my friend a drink and was yelling her. The drinks were horrible, and they up-ed the price on my second drink. Who does that?
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Lizett G.", "AuthorLocation": "Indio, CA"}

ReviewContent: Cocktails on the pricier side for what ya get. Great variety of beer and music is on point.Will come back for a performance at the venue as well. Great spot for watching sports games.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Ryan R.", "AuthorLocation": "Modesto, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great service, cool vibe and amazing bartenders. We will definitely be back. Downtown Berkeley modern design open floor plan and lots of drink choices. Lots.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Nadine G.", "AuthorLocation": "Danville, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great venue for live music. The sound is good for most genres of music. The floor space is adequate for a decent sized show. Bar prices are reasonable. We've seen a few shows here now and enjoyed each one. The restaurant side gets quite busy, but we've been able to get a table with a minimal wait. The service is good and the staff has been friendly. I'd say catch a show here and check it out for yourself.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "David H.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great beers for very reasonable prices. It's especially good if you're trying to have a quieter night for a conversation or a reunion. Bonus points if you get in time to grab the limited seats at their fireplace.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Chan V.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: We met up with a group of friends and everyone was having a great time by the time I got there. I ordered the salad with chicken breast and a vinaigrette dressing, I also ordered the Brussels sprouts. To quench my thirst I ordered an iced tea no sweetener. The iced tea was bold, cold and so refreshing. The chicken was cooked perfectly, not too dry and the serving size was average. I was especially hungry that night so I ordered a second serving of chicken. The extra serving seemed to do the trick in satisfying my growling gut. The Brussels sprouts were not hard and raw, they were cooked so they were soft but not mushy. The aioli dressing served on the side (thank goodness it was on the side or I would have eaten it all) was not over spiced, and rich with flavor. From the looks of the empty plates on the table I don't think there was a complaint by anyone as they were all scraped and almost appeared to be licked clean. The atmosphere was so inviting and the fire pits were a blaze whole there was laughter echoing throughout the back patio. It wasn't too chilly out back and a light sweater kept me totally comfortable.I am not a beer drinker myself, but the people that I was there with had great things to say and were trying the selections that sounded interesting to them. The smiling faces were a clue that this was a great time. I can't wait to go back the next time. Hopefully they have an apple cider or something that I can try. Looking forward to my trip back. Thank you Cornerstone. We will be back soon.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Mags W.", "AuthorLocation": "Castro Valley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great spot for a quick getaway! The food is good, there are plenty of selections to choose from and drinks galore. It's huge in here so there should never be a problem with finding a seat. I guess unless it's a Saturday. I can imagine this spot is packed on Friday Saturday nights because it's in the heart of Berkeley. I can't wait to find out.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Ramon J.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: We came here as a group of 20 to celebrate a birthday last night. Making reservations was easy and even though our party was large, I appreciated they didn't make me have a pre-fix menu. The food and service was great. The food came out quickly, hot and was very tasty. Our group had many special diets: gluten free, keto, vegan, and all were able to find things on the menu that they enjoyed. The beer selection was excellent and the specialty cocktails were good quality and well balanced. Plates were cleared quickly and drinks were refilled often. We loved the atmosphere, especially on the patio.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Diana O.", "AuthorLocation": "Livermore, CA"}

ReviewContent: I came to the cornerstone for a concert on Frdiay. The venue was small but had good lighting and a quality sound system. They only had tapped beers which were 8-9$ at the bar there along with similarly priced liquour and cocktails. I will come again if another artist I like is playing here
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Dean K.", "AuthorLocation": "North Beach, San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: The "shepherds pie" that says it's supposed to have mushrooms  is just a pile of carrots in pasta sauce topped with mashed potatoes. The two stars is for the great beer selection and the good salad we had. Please take this sham of a pie off the menu.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Moniqua L.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: The security at this place is AMAZING. I kept telling this NASTY man I did not want to dance with him, and they just got rid of him without me even asking. Beautiful.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Sophina G.", "AuthorLocation": "Rancho Cucamonga, CA"}

ReviewContent: Thoroughly enjoyed my Friday night here with friends!! Great bar service along with a separated dance floor in the back for concert performances/raves
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Diane H.", "AuthorLocation": "Fox Hollow, London, Canada"}

ReviewContent: Okay, I eat out all the time. Trying to incorporate a healthy nutrition program is harder than going to the gym. Stephanie Y posted a great review of Cornerstone Craft and photo their Superfood Salad. The store is two blocks from my gym and I enjoyed the post workout meal. The salad consists of kale, romaine, blueberries, avocado, farro*, dried cranberries, sunflower seed, edamame, goat cheese, with a tangy lemon chia seed vinaigrette. Isn't that a mouthful! Add shaved tri-tip!One of the best salads I've ever had!The menu looks fabulous and reasonably priced. There's a weekday 1/2 lunch special menu, all under $10!* Farro is an ancient whole grain with dietary benefits. Had to look it up!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "David N.", "AuthorLocation": "Las Vegas, NV"}

ReviewContent: I live nearby and have deemed this one of my regular weekend day drinking spots. Why, you ask? Because it's huge and I can let my toddler run loose like the free spirit he is. And while he is doing laps or petting a random dog (yes, this place is also dog friendly), my husband and I enjoy amazing beers from their bountiful craft selection and nibble on decent bar food.There's an outdoor space with fire pits. The music area is pretty small making what would either be a somewhat intimate venue or a crowded shitshow. When there isn't concert going on, I think you can also enjoy that space with cornhole and ping pong.I wouldn't get the meatball again, the salads are overpriced but good. The burgers and sandwiches I think are the move. They come with fries and they're reasonably priced.Overall, I'm into it.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Stephanie Y.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: They have kombucha ON TAP and that's all I have to say about the bar (aka I love that). I really appreciate this place's vibe with the different sections of live music. Their show backroom is super cozy and a great space! Definitely love that there's an upstairs that isn't too stuffy and has a plethora of seats. Can't say much about the food/drinks because I've never sat and experienced it, but I'd definitely come back here for another show!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Jennifer T.", "AuthorLocation": "San Jose, CA"}

ReviewContent: I have been here twice for an after work event. I like how large the entire space is.  The first time here, we had the couch space in the front of the house.   The second time, the back area, near the patio.   With tables placed around the area, it allowed me to mingle with my group without feeling confined.We had several happy our dishes during my visit.   It consisted of the olives, fries, antipasti, and nachos.   From my both visit, it liked the nachos.   The chips were crisp with the melted cheese. I am a sucker for nachos and this one was good. White cheddar with pork.  Delicious.I will need to visit for lunch to try the cornerstone burger.  It read delicious.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Marck N.", "AuthorLocation": "Emeryville, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great for drinks, awful for live music. An iPhone 4 stuck 3 inches in a bowl of mashed potatoes would have better acoustics than this place
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Davis G.", "AuthorLocation": "Davidson, NC"}

ReviewContent: The venue has been pretty helpful with information. Great selection of beers and a good food. I'm not sure what people could be complaining about. By far the best venue in the East Bay
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Brian H.", "AuthorLocation": "Sequoyah, Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: I attended cornerstone as a guest.  They have live music in a large room- kind of rounded with a wooden ceiling much like being in Noah's ark.  The staff was incredibly friendly and courteous- super helpful with any questions to which I had.  I ordered the BLT salad while I was there; the food was tasty and I am not sure what the dressing was for the salad but it was refreshing.Really awesome venue with a great staff and located in an area that gets some decent foot traffic for a Friday night.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Brandi H.", "AuthorLocation": "Sacramento, CA"}

ReviewContent: Afternoons: Service is sometimes painfully slow, but usually it's okay. Probably not the best bar in the area but it gets the job done. There are sometimes flies at the bar, kinda gross, especially when it's near the alcohol. Beers are about $5 during happy hour (3 to 6pm) and $7 otherwise.Evenings: The cocktails here are really strong, great cocktails. You'll find an older crowd usually unless there's a game going on. There typically aren't too many students here. This is owned by the same people as Pappy's. It's honestly not a bad bar at all but I have to rate it relative to the other bars in the area (specifically in the Telegraph/Durant area, which includes Raleigh's, Tap Haus and Kips). This is a good spot for a pregame in my opinion.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Neel S.", "AuthorLocation": "Chicago, IL"}

ReviewContent: Supremely disappointed by their service. Food was good though.The front sign said seat yourself and so we did. Once we sat down, we were able to view the selection of drinks they had posted, but no food menus given to us yet. I can see that there were a total of 8 people working the floor that night (3 at the bar and 5 on the floor). I can see the bar being busy with serving drinks, but the amount of time it took for me to receive a menu was ridiculous. I waited 10 minutes until I flagged someone down for a menu (they said they'll come back to me; never did). Another 5 minutes to realize the person I flagged down is nowhere to be seen. Another 5 minutes to order a drink from the bar and then they helped me flag down someone to hand me some food menus. Then another 10 minutes to flag someone down to order food. I was keeping track of the time because there was a game that night. No offense, but that was a lot of work for someone paying for service...I ordered the chicken pot pie that night and a burger. Both items were delicious, especially the pot pie. I was highly impressed by how flakey the crust was. For the burger, the pickles were phenomenal!  The drink menu was impressed and I really did like the selection. Although, I don't care to come back here but I do want to give this establishment another chance. So we'll see what will happen.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Leme K.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: This place took over the old Thalassa's that used be here. The bar looks very different than what it used to be with plenty of seating when you walk in and even out door seating with warm fire Pitts. On the second level they have ping pong tables, a stage for bands to play and small standing tables for you to stand and enjoy your drink. This bar seems very college friendly especially with the games they have. The reason this place wasn't 5 stars for me is because they checked my id numerous times (walking in, the bar, and then some random guy outside to give me a wrist band of some sort). Not sure what the wrist band was for but who knows?! Another thing I didn't like was it was Friday night around 10:30 when we arrived and this place closed 30 minutes later at 11pm! What kind of bar closes at 11pm in Berkeley on a Friday night?! I just found it so odd. It's like the guys who were working (by the way they were all males) just wanted to close up just so they can get their Friday night started. I'm sure they lost a lot of money for closing before midnight. Oh and as for the service it was just blah. No customer service what so ever.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Christina M.", "AuthorLocation": "Hercules, CA"}

ReviewContent: Specifically went to a concert here for the California Honeydrops that we waited patiently for but for some unknown reason started 2 hours late! (Not the restaurant's fault!) Should've enjoyed our dinner a lot longer is my only regret! Thank goodness our evening wasn't a total waste because we were all pleasantly surprised by this Berkeley Tavern that had more than just craft beers to offer us! We were all impressed with their extensive menu of really interesting food options, beer on tap, great wines and signature cocktails too! Loved building my own cheeseboard that included roasted cauliflower and brussel sprouts, meats and cheeses, baked olives and delicious aioli's to dip our homemade ciabatta and veggies in! Such a great option for vegetarians! (Minus the meat option of course!) : ) Since there were 5 of us we ordered an array of many different dishes that we all got to sample and that were all great in their own right! Grilled Tofu & Avocado Sandwich, Grilled Meatloaf sandwich, Mac n cheese, Grilled Sausage board, Chicken Pot Pie, French Fries, Stuffed Deviled Eggs, Roasted nuts and a delicious bowl of their Roasted Tomato soup! Yes, we overindulged but the good thing is this Elite Yelper can honestly report that all of the food listed above in this review was flavorful and delicious! I tasted everything! AND no complaints from any of the other foodies at our table! Special shout out to our servers and all of the waitstaff who were all very attentive, friendly and even with the large crowd this busy concert night, were all very responsive and provided great service! Thank you! We'll be back!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Barbara N.", "AuthorLocation": "Sarasota, FL"}

ReviewContent: Five star for food! 2.5 star for service. We ordered burgers and sides. No drinks (they were out of kombucha) The cauliflower and brussel sprouts were cooked perfectly. I really wish I could learn how to cook the cauliflower so it's roasted but moist and the perfect texture. Ate at the bar and the service was frustrating at times. There were only three of us in there to start, but the bartender seemed flustered and kept getting confused about what he was doing - bringing things we already had, forgetting to add parts to our order. As more people came in he spent 20-30 minutes at the end of the bar, and it was impossible to get his attention/he never checked in. Would still go again for the good food.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Melissa M.", "AuthorLocation": "Downtown Berkeley, Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: I went to Cornerstone for the California Honeydrops show and had dinner beforehand. We were debating going elsewhere for dinner but ate there for convenience's sake. The show was great (despite starting 40 minutes after the show was advertised to begin) and I liked the venue enough, but this review is for the restaurant.Heads up, the service here on a Thursday night was horrendous. Look at my other reviews - I am not a big complainer about service - I know people get busy! - but our waitress was definitely not overloaded. I saw her standing around chatting with her co-workers several times while I was there. It was extremely difficult to get her attention.I ordered a cocktail and my dinner at the same time. For the record, I got the Grilled Chicken Club, which was actually pretty decent and I would order it again. We also got the big slice of chocolate cake which was tasty, albeit VERY dense, but you definitely get your chocolate fix.However, my drink didn't come at all, and once our food was served, I asked where our drinks were. The waitress looked confused, left for several more minutes, and came back and said it was her mistake. She finally brought our drinks out a bit later. She said something about comping our drinks due to her mistake, which I thought was the right thing to do.I had to go out of my way to flag her down every time I wanted to order another drink or ask for dessert, even when she walked by our table several times. It made me feel really weird and stupid. I've never had to try so hard to spend more money at a restaurant.When we got our bill, I noticed that she only comped my sister's drink, which was a $3 diet Coke. I was charged for all three drinks I ordered. I don't ask for special treatment or anything, but the service was so bad that this kind of upset me. I was honestly expecting her to take one of my drinks off for the mishap.Overall, I would definitely go back to the venue for another show, but there's no way in hell I would sit down for a meal again. There are TONS of amazing options for dinner close to the venue and I would highly recommend supporting one of those businesses rather than going to the Cornerstone restaurant. Maybe I just got a bad waitress or I got someone on a bad day, but it was enough to turn me off forever.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Liz G.", "AuthorLocation": "Healdsburg, CA"}

ReviewContent: Went to a concert here last night, called Wednesday at 12:41 pm to make a reservation for Thursday evening for the dining room at 7 pm as the show started around 8pm, and the headliners would be in around 9:40pm. Reservation was confirmed for 7pm on 12/13 by a younger man on the phone who asked me to leave my phone number in case anything changes. We arrived and were told that a private party had booked the event. I was confused because I looked back through my phone and no one had called to tell me that. A younger blonde woman basically told us "too bad" and turned us away because no one had written anything down. She was completely rude and from having worked in the restaurant industry, she should not have be working there just based on that encounter. Unbelievable. It was too late to find another location close to the venue to eat and they do not serve food at the bar. Very disappointed, it ruined my husbands birthday dinner. Only good thing was the music and we will make sure to see them elsewhere from now on. Awful Service.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Ky N.", "AuthorLocation": "Tracy, CA"}

ReviewContent: No flights. Lame. The bartender limited my taste selection at 3 beers. That being said there is a nice beer selection. Good looking food selection.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Mr D.", "AuthorLocation": "Long Beach, CA"}

ReviewContent: My friend fro NYC is in town so we took him here as this place has turned into the best spot to hang out in town. Today the consistency went down the drain at the bar, our problem? It took 28 mins to order food at the bar with only a handful of customers but the manager was busy doing tastings and the girl with the blond hair was too busy chatting with male customers we sat down, another guy walked in way after us and got service right away!!! We have never experienced this ever! We were about to walk out and she approached, we stay as is cold and rainy and we didn't want to go anywhere else. We finally get some drinks...we are hungry, no menus she is at the other side of the back with other coworkers and talking to some guys at the other end...we are like really ?we had to wait another 15-18 mins and my friend went down and ask her if we could order food. we got food as we are eating at the bar enjoying the food and finally enjoying our selfs....some guys as he is leaving asked her if she wants tacos later...her reply was; oh no I went to the doctors today and I almost vomited when I was told I was over weight and trust me she is not over weight if anything she could use to eat a little more...my eyes opened wide as the customer right inform of her it is a little chubby and he look at her and than looked down.that's something oh don't say in front of customers that are eating. I am sorry  and what's crazy is the bar  manager all they do is mess around and flirt instead of managing what employers are doing. Tonight was a waste of time and money plus here is our friend from NYC so much for showing "our favorite spot" So if you are a guy who is not a ten don't bother while she is bartending. Just no happy with the experience today
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Emma M.", "AuthorLocation": "Albany, CA"}

ReviewContent: I love coming here! The first time I came here was to see Said the Sky and was surprised that they had such a broad selection of craft beer to choose from next to their dancing arena.The stage set up is next door to the restaurant and craft beer area of the place and they make you put your alcohol in a plastic cup to go to the dancing area. Most recently, I've been coming here for their craft beers! They have a wide selection and there's usually something new here on tap whenever I come back. The beer prices are usually range between $6-$13. The waiting staff are super friendly, nice, and give good beer recommendations! If you're here for the food and you're under 21, they check ID's around 9:30-10PM. I would recommend trying out the sours here! I haven't been disappointed with any of sours that I've tried!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Jason T.", "AuthorLocation": "Cupertino, CA"}

ReviewContent: 15 minutes waiting for one of five bartenders to acknowledge us. The place wasn't even busy. It has happened to us before. We won't be returning.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Cesar T.", "AuthorLocation": "Albany, CA"}

ReviewContent: We stopped by for a post-theatre dinner. The food was indifferent and the service quirky.  We had "vegetarian shepherd's pie" and chicken pot pie, neither of which were to write home about. Before the mains were brought, a total of two modest pieces of bread were provided for a table for four.  I asked for a "bread plate." The server brought empty plates on which a person could put bread, if bread there were,  but there wasn't! We are not tempted to return.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Martin P.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: I went to a show last night and while the music, sound system and music hall were excellent the crowd was absolutely horrible. So many people talking made the first artist cut his set short. The second band played loudly enough that they weren't bothered by the noise but trying to listen to the music with people carrying on loud conversations all around me was frustrating and distracting. I don't understand why people buy tickets to see music and then carry on as if they are in their living rooms listening to their stereo. Perhaps they should stay home and do just that instead of ruining an evening of fine music for everyone else. I would suggest that the management put up signs at the entrance asking people to be respectful of the musicians and other people who came to hear the music. Making an announcement before the music begins would also be helpful.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Daniele F.", "AuthorLocation": "San Rafael, CA"}

ReviewContent: Really cool new spot in Berkeley. Half of it is a brewery restaurant and the other half is a concert venue. The interior of the brewery is really large and spacious with high ceilings, exposed brick, and large seating areas really good for groups. There's also a nice outside area with fire pits. They have an extensive menu with some really interesting beers, some I haven't even heard of before, for example we tried a cider made from pluot fruits. They also have a decent sized food menu consisting of apps, burgers, sandwiches, etc. From their menu it looks like charcuterie is also a thing here, although we didn't try it. The food was quite good, nothing amazing, but up to the standard of more high end breweries these days. The venue is adjacent to the brewery. It has a separate entrance outside although once you're in, there is a doorway to go in between the two. It's a moderately sized club room, maybe fits around 500 people. The sound system in there is really clear and the stage is high enough that you have a good view of the bands playing from pretty much every part of the room. Definitely all makes for a great night out to grab some beer or food before/after an awesome show.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Catherine Y.", "AuthorLocation": "Los Angeles, CA"}

ReviewContent: Was there tonight for a concert. Was in the restaurant before the show. Service was terrible. Wasn't taken care of at all. Was painful to order every round of beer. Waiter would disappear. Not sure how a person gets their buzz on here. Great atmosphere but dissatisfied.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Andy H.", "AuthorLocation": "Fairfield, CA"}

ReviewContent: Cornerstone offers a solid selection of beers for any consumer - gose, cider, belgian dubbel, IPA, stouts, and many other varieties. They also seem appropriately priced. Better yet, they also have some interesting options for the more adventurous. During my visit I saw redwood tip beer and barrel-aged sour.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Justin S.", "AuthorLocation": "Boston, MA"}

ReviewContent: I love the cornerstone! Great food, great service. GREAT venue. Friendly bartenders and staff. Ken was great and took care of us at the bar for drinks and appetizers. We come from Redwood City to see our favorite bands and have a fabulous time!!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Christine V.", "AuthorLocation": "Redwood City, CA"}

ReviewContent: Very nice music venue in the heart of Berkeley. Great ticket prices and super intimate. I want to rock this joint someday soon:)
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Michael H.", "AuthorLocation": "Central LA, Los Angeles, CA"}

ReviewContent: Wow, I got here at 4pm, and the bartender setting up, completely ignored me. After 15min I got up and went to the other side of the bar to get a beer and a shot. I am in no hurry, but that guys energy, and purposely ignoring me, it sad, he seems miserable and in the wrong business! Costumers service should be everybodys responsible, he could should have told the other bartender, that was checking out, that I was waiting. Anyways, maybe the manager, or the owners can take notice!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Pata D.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great choice of craft beers.. love the variety.. especially their hoppy beers. good place to hang out in the evenings. They get really busy though.. might be difficult to get a table if you come during peak hours
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Venkatraman R.", "AuthorLocation": "Fremont, CA"}

ReviewContent: Free table reservations/ ample seating/plenty of TVsI love cornerstone ! 1. Happy hour options: I'm a fan of any place with a cheap/ tasty margarita 2. Free table reservations: this process is really simple. You can call ahead, reserve tables for a select # of people- no fee but your guests should arrive together on Time! We had a nice view of the TV for playoffs 3. Attentive  staff 4. Close to BART5. Live shows (I really wish they'd bring Bone Thugz and Harmony back )The bad:- parking is suspect and difficult
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Mariana D.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: We came here Friday night for the Fleetwood Mask and the Illeagles show. Got there about 5 or 6 I'm guessing and had some beers and dinner first. We sat at the bar. It's crazy packed and loud but we have it a go. THe bartenders are CRAZY busy. People were constantly hovering behind us to order drinks. The beer choices are amazing. The food choices are so amazing it was hard to decide. I got the Brussels sprouts then the nachos but subbed chicken instead of pork belly. They have community like tables which aren't my thing so we sat at the bar instead. The venues awesome also. It has a small staircase that goes into the venue. So you could have dinner then the doors opened at 7:30 and you could go in. It has an upstairs so you can watch from above. That's what we did. It's a nice view. Standing only. No seats. Has a small bar at the back of the venue. Had a blast. We will be back. We ubered In so idk how parking is or if there is any. It's a great time for a small price. THe tickets  presale were like $24. Check em out!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Chrissy S.", "AuthorLocation": "Tracy, CA"}

ReviewContent: This is one of the nicest bars/lounges in Berkeley. It's been completely renovated so everything is nice and new. Decent happy hour prices and good service. The host concerts here on the weekend and it gets packed for local sporting events! Upscale college crowd and locals! Nice bar area! Decent prices! All those things are why I keep coming back. Definitely my go to in Berkeley!!This review is simply missing a star cuz parking on Shattuck is brutal and the inner cheapskate in me wishes happy hour drink prices were better.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Roxanne H.", "AuthorLocation": "Morgan Hill, CA"}

ReviewContent: I LOVE CORNERSTONEI have been to this location twice: once when a show was happening and once when there was no shows. Both times a completely different, yet AMAZING experience! When I went when there was no show and it was a little more slow, there were ping pong tables/games and fun music blasting. Drinks were great, the energy was fun, everything was good. When there was a show... let me tell you. It gets PACKED in there. Despite the sheer amount of people, the bartender was attentive and friendly and even made time to joke around with me. I loved it. The drinks were amazing and the beer list was dope. I highly recommend you check this place out whenever you can because I can assure you that you will have a good time!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Sarah M.", "AuthorLocation": "Dublin, CA"}

ReviewContent: What an amazing English Beat Show! Intimate setting, mellow crowd, great beers, fun staff! The band was having fun, enthusiastic and tight. Flashbacked to '81, same vibe. The Cornerstone Crew have this music thing nailed. Cheers!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Steve G.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: I live in the neighborhood and would love to become a regular here, for a few glasses of wine or beer. The selection and prices are great. However, I am "a woman of a certain age", and each of the several times I have been here, the bartender's lack of interest borders on rudeness. I do not feel noticed, let alone welcomed. T
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Diane C.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: They lost about $200 in revenue today.  That's how much we would have spent for drinks and dinner and snacks. When we left early, several other people also left. Read below to understand why.I've been here before and it was fine. This time there were less than 20 people there, and the waitstaff didn't think that was enough to hang around. They disappeared a couple times especially when we wanted to order something. We came here to watch the Cal football game, and even called ahead to confirm was playing. When the time arrived they pullled up DIRECTV, which does not have that the PAC 12 network which was showing the Cal game this weekend.  Clearly the staff and management and or someone who answers the phone has no idea how to work a sports bar.   Let me see -- this place is in Berkeley. Cal plays in Berkeley. What would it take to subscribe to a different package and get the PAC 12 network?We canceled our drink order and never ordered any food. We left for another local bar.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "M L.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Called ahead to make sure we could catch the Cal game and was told the game would be on. Planned to stay and watch the USC - Texas game as well. Got a great seat and checked out the menu. After about 10 minutes we found out that they don't have PAC-12 network. Service was slow but maybe that worked in our favor since the bartender didn't have a chance to get to our order. Not sure I'll go back. We walked about 10 minutes to Triple Rock where they were showing the game. Still no idea if the food is any good at Cornerstone.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Robin N.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: If you want to wait 45 minutes for a drink, this is the spot!  #barrescueThis is all I wanted to say but, apparently, there's a minimum word count.  Hope this works.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Nicole R.", "AuthorLocation": "South Lake Tahoe, CA"}

ReviewContent: Cornerstone - what a pleasant surprise! My boyfriend and I made our way to Cornerstone to see Travis Garland back in February and were amazed at the amount of space that was available in both the bar/restaurant area and the music venue. We arrived about 30 minutes before the show started and were directed to the back of the restaurant and up a flight of stairs to the music venue. There weren't too many people in there so we decided to explore a bit. We ordered some beers at the bar and took a seat on the outdoor patio area and then inside on some couch style seating. Once we were ready to head back in, we walked back up the stairs for the show. The sound was alright, but we had a blast regardless - so much so that I lost my voice the next day. The best part was meeting Travis at the end of the concert. He came out to sign some autographs and take a few photos by the merch table in the back of the hall. Hope to be back soon!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Camille B.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: I love the venue, for local music! It's very Intimate and I loved that it was walking distance from my home
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Karin M.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Updating my review to reflect service on a Friday night ~7:30. I came back with my doggy and was offered a water bowl, and was seen by a server within 5 minutes of sitting down outside. I ordered my own food (big ass chocolate cake and a house coffee) and a side of bacon for my dog, and my server (Robert) offered a plate of dog biscuits and double checked that I still wanted the bacon. He came by probably four times throughout my meal to make sure that I had everything I needed. The patio area is so lovely. They had two cozy fire pits going around some benches, a perfect area for a group of people who are just having some drinks, but the heat reaches to the tables too so it isn't too cold at night. I left my apartment wishing I'd brought a jacket, but felt totally comfortable sitting outside.I came just for dessert this time, and the chocolate cake was SO good. It has layers of moist cake and fudgy chocolate ganache and can easily be shared between two people, even on an empty stomach. The coffee was lukewarm when I got it, so I'm not sure if it had been sitting out for a bit because I'd had the cake for maybe ten minutes already before the coffee and bacon came, but that meant that I could drink it immediately without having to wait for it to cool down. Robert also made an extra trip to bring me out some cream, sugar, and an extra spoon for my coffee. All in all, I love the environment at Cornerstone. Many dog-friendly places in Berkeley serve only beer and have cramped patios with limited to no heat, which is an unpleasant experience for both humans and dogs and makes me anxious about my big guy being a pest. At Cornerstone, everyone wants to give him attention, and there is plenty of room for us to sit without bothering other people. We will definitely make this our regular weekend hangout.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Maggie A.", "AuthorLocation": "Elk Grove, CA"}

ReviewContent: Foods okay, prices are good, but for the love of God, please hire more servers!! One server per 15 tables is unacceptable.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Nahal G.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Our family and friends came in as a party of 20 for my Mother in Law's 60th birthday earlier this month. My husband and I had high expectations because of the Yelp reviews and pictures, plus the idea of so many draft beers. Our server was polite, and the hostess was courteous when it came to seating because we had children with us, and needed a booth- but she was able to still keep such a large party together. Unfortunately that was the best part of our experience.  I was incredibly disappointed with my sandwich, a Meatloaf Melt, it was super dry and lacked flavor. Our Charcuterie plate was not what we ordered, there was a questionable mystery meat and it was definitely not what we ordered, the macaroni and cheese balls app was like something you'd buy frozen and just reheated. When we first arrived, our server offered to return with a Happy Hour Menu, then came back telling us that there was no Friday Happy Hour, she forgot. A man from our party asked two employees the same question about a beer and was told both times that they didn't know the answer. So instead of saying they'd check on it, or go get an answer for him, like a good employee would be trained to do, they just walked away. My Father in Law pre purchased tickets for the show for that night, this is the whole reason we were there. We had five kids 8 and under with us, it was an all age show. Or party was the first to enter the entertainment area, there was only five other people in there, not including the two bartenders- when a bartender told my Sister in Law that we needed to control our "rambunctious kids," because they were, "receiving multiple complaints." So this means that the other customers waiting for the show to start- that we were talking to- and even talked to about the show and the kids- somehow complained. I will never return. Our family spent a lot of money and the only good part was the show that we could have seen for free closer to home, but thought this would be a fun experience.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Lindsay Y.", "AuthorLocation": "Upland, CA"}

ReviewContent: I rarely find a restaurant especially one that is in a bar 5 stars. The food is off the charts good. Great flavor and cooked to my liking. The prices are perfect for what you are getting . Very rarely do I find a place that my whole family liked the food. Not only was the food great but the beverages both adult and kid friendly drinks hit the spot. If you are looking for nice place to eat and relax while in Berkeley this is it. If your going their for a show go early enough to get dinner first. You won't be disappointed.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Chris L.", "AuthorLocation": "Reno, NV"}

ReviewContent: First time here for a concert to see a group called, "Wild Child."Went in to check in with the host up front and told her we were here for the concert and it was our first time. My group of friends and I were taken to a table and were given drink menus, but we were wondering: WHERE IS THE CONCERT?!We had no idea where it was taking place until one of our friends started walking around and all of a sudden saw another room with two open doors and staircases to get into the music venue.So minus -2 stars for that, we weren't exactly told where the concert would be taking place even though we told our host that we were here for the concert and she didn't really direct us anywhere. :(It's a nice small tiny venue, great for intimate concerts! Would probably be back again sometime for a band or artist I like.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Monique M.", "AuthorLocation": "San Jose, CA"}

ReviewContent: I went to the Cornerstone to see the local Prince tribute band the Purple ones. At the front door of the restaurant, we were told that "yes, I see your reservation, but you weren't assigned a table, so you'll have to stand in line". We ended up bypassing the hostess and asked another waitstaff person to help us get a table (which she did). So that worked out, but was odd. We only stayed for about 7 songs of the bands, they were great players, but who ever was mixing had the kick drum and bass turned up so high that you could barely hear the singers, synths or guitars and the volume level was painful. You can rock a house without having to damage people's eardrums. Sometimes I couldn't even tell what key the band was in, because all of the harmonic instruments were so burried. This place deserves a better soundman.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Susie D.", "AuthorLocation": "Richmond, CA"}

ReviewContent: I arrived shortly after 4:00, sat at the bar awaiting the arrival of my friends 15 minutes went by and I was not acknowledged at all by the bartender. I saw a waitress and asked if I would get service at a table and she said yes. I moved to a table and shortly after was joined by my friends. Service was ok, however this woman in a black dress with long flowing long hair delivered our food with white disposable gloves on which was very unsanitary.  In my party, there were two safe serve certified folks and they refused to eat the food that she delivered. The other servers did not have on the gloves. We will think twice before returning despite the convenience of the location.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Patty S.", "AuthorLocation": "Missouri City, TX"}

ReviewContent: I came here for a drink with a few friends a month or two back and our waitress was very attentive and super nice! We were able to ask for some samples before deciding on what drink to get. I had one of their chocolate beers if I recalled correctly...super good! The atmosphere was super chill and spacious! Not so crowded around the time we went and I believe it was a Friday night? We headed over here after dinner so we were all pretty full...which was upsetting because they had a lot of foods on their menu that sounded good to snack on. Maybe next time when I decide to come back I will definitely save some room to order the food on their menu! They have some bands that play too, I believe! Really fun and you can just dance around. Overall, I highly recommend coming here for a night out with friends without having to worry about being too crowded with other people. Their place is huge!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Cathy L.", "AuthorLocation": "San Jose, CA"}

ReviewContent: So, my friend was the one who recommended me to come here for their BBQ nachos. I was super stoked about it! I am always down to dive into a big pile of ooey, gooey nachos.I came here with a friend around 9:00pm. When we walked into the restaurant, there was a sign that said to seat ourselves, so we walked over to a comfortable booth and got ourselves situated. And... we wait....And... we waited some more...And... we waited even longer...For about 30 minutes we waited, in a near empty restaurant (there were only 2 other groups sitting on the floor and maybe 2-3 people sitting in the bar area). Not once did anyone come greet us, come up to us, not even bring us water.Needless to say, terrible service. This is literally THE WORST service I have ever received at a restaurant. Even some bad service, they at least greeted me and/or brought us water. But here? Nothing. They were still opened for another THREE HOURS; it's not like we came in near closing or something and they just didn't want to serve/wait on another table. They genuinely just didn't care.Some of you may say, 'Why didn't you just get someone's attention?' Well, what's the point of putting up a 'seat yourselves' sign if they weren't going to wait on us anyway? My friend and I ended up walking out, no one even bothered trying to stop us, or even a goodbye. Just like the wind, we left without any acknowledgment.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Ray L.", "AuthorLocation": "Houston, TX"}

ReviewContent: I came here for an all ages Cupcakke show and didn't know what to expect.First of all, Cupcakke is not for all ages. In fact, she's probably the least appropriate artist I can think of if you don't count R. Kelly's real life shenanigans. But the tickets ended up only being $5 and I had a group of 4 friends who were down to commute from the city to see her so I was all in event though I'm pretty sure I was the oldest person there besides security. Second, man am I glad we asked about the show and figured out that we needed to move into the second level main stage. When we walked in we saw a pretty quiet family-friendly brew pub, a cute outdoor area, and pretty small stage with a very demure act playing and thought, 'Where the fuck is Cupcakke? This can't be right.'The main pub area is really cute and clean and has an almost preppy vibe to it. We skipped the bar here and headed up to the main stage venue get a good spot... which was actually in the very back by the bar. Somehow it was still a pretty good spot to see the whole show. They've got a water station set up with cups so you can hydrate as much as you'd like and the bar was pretty cheap, as well. Security was so nice and the crowd, even tho mostly Berkeley college co-eds was great. Super respectful, very queer friendly, and everyone just had fun and cheered for Cupcakke and her very NSFW message. I'd go back in a heartbeat now knowing how great the space is and how affordable the shows can be.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Carl F.", "AuthorLocation": "CA, CA"}

ReviewContent: I recently saw Ace Frehley in the music venue part of the Cornerstone and it was excellent. I was able to find street parking without a problem. Nice intimate stage and sound quality was great. The room was kept nice cool despite being a fairly full crowd. And even though the doors opened almost an hour late due to board issues, the staff kept everyone informed so nobody was guessing and even pre checked ids and tickets so when the doors opened, there was no wait. I look forward to seeing many more shows here. Great venue
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Todd R.", "AuthorLocation": "Pleasant Hill, CA"}

ReviewContent: We were seated quickly even though it was a busy evening without reservations. The servers frequently check up on each party, and the orders for food and drinks were quick. I ordered vegetarian tenders which were delicious. I sampled my friends' food which included tasty fries, Mac & cheese balls, burgers, etc. Drinks were great as well. The overall atmosphere was fun, clean, and enjoyable for outings.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "F S.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: A couple friends and I came by since we were in the area. We got a couple of things to share and we were pleasantly surprised. You can make your own cheese boards and there are different appetizers you can try as well. We got the Brussel sprouts, Mac and cheese balls and a burrata and chicken apple sausage. Everything was great except the brussel sprouts, i think if they were roasted they would've been bomb but they were slightly soggy so I'd skip on that next time. My two friends got a beer and cider can't remember what kind but they loved it. I'd def come back to try more things off the menu.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Hanan A.", "AuthorLocation": "Garland, TX"}

ReviewContent: Had lunch here a couple months ago. Our friend who is allergic to pork and chicken and dairy got extremely sick after eating a hamburger here. Must have been some cross contamination . Emailed the restaurant and never got a reply. Just wanted to kno if pork is cooked on the same grill. She won't go back. Too bad. Was a convenient place.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "dean k.", "AuthorLocation": "El Cerrito, CA"}

ReviewContent: The Good: This place has a great ambiance and decor. If you are looking for a chill place to grab some drinks than this is your spot. The hummus and the soft pretzel were delicious. Our server, Justin, was very friendly and had great customer service. The Bad: Unfortunately, the back of the house has some issues. When we ordered the soft pretzel, we asked for no mustard but it came with it anyway. I ordered a cheeseburger to go and asked for no onions and add jalapeños. When I got home, my cheeseburger had onions and they didn't give me the jalapeños. And guess what? I was charged extra $ for the jalapeños. Management needs to do some more training with the staff. I hope they learn from the the insight of this review.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Anand P.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: Best bar in all of Berkeley. The live band Mama Brd was incredible!! Played at a great sound level and comfortable tone. When you're in town, you have to visit! Would recommend to anyone.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Adam G.", "AuthorLocation": "Denver, CO"}
