ReviewContent: Second visit to this venue for music, first time for food. For music, absolutely loved! This time around I saw toyGuitar and Juliette and The Licks. Sold out show and we still had breathing room, which is not always the case with other venues so it was greatly appreciated. Our meal took so long though! The super perk is that we did not have to walk around to Will Call, our waitress actually printed our tickets for us, score!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Deanna C.", "AuthorLocation": "Petaluma, CA"}

ReviewContent: Cornerstone is a nice restaurant and I mostly enjoyed my time eating dinner there. ***Restraunt:Pros: 1. The Atmosphere is attractive and the space is open and inviting.2. The food and drink are impeccable. Everything we ate and drank was better than it would have been anywhere else. Amazing attention was spent on the food, you can tell that the chefs take great care in what they do. Even something as simple as a cheeseburger was beyond perfection and so well done I regret not taking a snapshot to show the presentation. Sadly I wolfed it down before it had occurred to me. Artisan pickles were also a nice touch.3.Great beer, wine, and drink selection. (Understatement)4.Attentive and professional waitstaff. (We tipped well as should you.)**Cons: -1. Okay, I get it, this place has live music.  The woman who performed while we ate in the dining area was so loud my wife and I could not hear our server or each other. I like to talk while I eat, or at the very least be able to talk to the waitstaff, this was made nearly impossible. My wife and I ended up texting to each other after failed attempts to converse. This alone ruined what should have been a pleasant dining experience. I have no complaint about the musician's ability to play, she did a great job and has a pleasant voice. However, I've worked with musicians- and have done gopher work setting up amps. I've done enough sound checks to know that this performer set up her amp as high as she could go because she wanted everyone in the large space to hear her. You are out of luck if you were near the stage as we were. Interestingly enough,  the guy who performed afterward turned it down and we could hear each other. Nice, but she warned us she would be coming back making any desire for dessert crushed.  Cornerstone should pay attention to this because my wife just doesn't feel like it's worth our time.****Performance Space: Attached but not inside the restaurant.--1.Nice and roomy, a good venue for a performance. The music was not too loud and they have an excellent sound system. 2. I didn't use the bar but they seem to have professional staff as I never saw a line at the bar and that's unusual. You can take your wine or beer in from the restaurant but it has to be in plastic cups, no problem.3.Clean bathrooms. I know that sounds trite but that's always a plus at a music venue to me.I think if I could make sure I could sit outside and there would not be music blasting in our face in the restaurant- I might eat at Cornerstone again.However, I'm getting tired of restaurants not getting that people would like to talk and enjoy each others company if you don't get that and don't pay attention to this detail, you could lose customers. (Create the Restraunt you want to eat in. Sit down and eat a meal in the main dining room and hold a conversation with someone, see what happens.) I suggest maybe hiring someone with an acoustic guitar or playing music over the PA that's not too loud. (Or have no music at all, people can always go to the attached Music Venue provided.)
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Dean J.", "AuthorLocation": "Tracy, CA"}

ReviewContent: The door was open so a lot of cigarette smoke kept coming in. They got to shoo all those people further down the street or something. Out of two beers on menu but menu was supposedly out of date?
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "P D.", "AuthorLocation": "Emeryville, CA"}

ReviewContent: The food is bad. The service is worse. They card 80 year olds. Get it together people.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Mark G.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: This place is great! The food is great, the service could be better (hey don't seem to have enough staff during world cup games), but they're trying, and they have a fairly good beer selection. I highly recommend the pulled pork. Amazing.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Gaby F.", "AuthorLocation": "Alameda, CA"}

ReviewContent: I really enjoyed my night , Kanen or kan I'm not sure if I spelled it right , but he is an awesome bartender! He is really helpful, amazing customer service and he is know what is he doing ! Good job
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Ruta T.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: Not even busy and the bartender has skipped over me twice. Didn't know I had to wait 20 mins for a lousy,  beer selection.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Matt L.", "AuthorLocation": "Clayton, OH"}

ReviewContent: I've always loved the vibe and service. Very open, beautiful space (especially outback) with great service. Both food and bar and a great bet. The food can be a little bland but the menu has a nice variety. The Brussel Sprouts and Appetizer platters are great. Superfood Salad is also a win.Perfect for watching games!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Sarah R.", "AuthorLocation": "Orinda, CA"}

ReviewContent: Super cool venue with lots of seating in various areas. Outside on the patio with heaters. Long bar with tons of local beers on tap. Super original ones. I read before hand that parking is a bit$$ but I found a spot literally at the door!! Lucky bastard, I know. :)The jalapeño beer was one that note worthy with a light jalapeño after taste that blew my mind. The lagers are always my faves. We had a snack before hand at the bar of generous portion of hummus and olives with delicious bread. Next we all met up before a concert we were going to there and sat at a table with the rest of the gang. Chicken wings and pork nachos are bomb. The concert was organized and felt very intimate. We loved it and enjoyed more drinks inside the venue. Awesome service always from all the bartenders. On this occasion we saw the "Aterciopelados" a  famous Colombian band from the 90s. Everyone was on their best behavior and it was much appreciated and enjoyed by all.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Theresa G.", "AuthorLocation": "Sacramento, CA"}

ReviewContent: Food is decent. Bar fair I had fish and chip good portion and above average. Whatched part of  NBA finals here. The place was a zoo and school was out!! The servers did the best they could with the crowed.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Dom B.", "AuthorLocation": "Sacramento, CA"}

ReviewContent: Huge space with nice outdoor patio.  The patio is mainly communal seating.  There is a TV and a fire pit to create a nice atmosphere. It was a warm day so we sat outside and watched the Warriors game. Pretty good beer selection. I believe we had the Fieldworks IPA which is my favorite and I really love when places have local beers on tap. I was super stoked they had a vegetarian shepherds pie!  Yum!  We also go the pretzel which was yummy, but could have had a little more of the sauces that came with it.  Over all a really cool place and I will go back again.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Megan M.", "AuthorLocation": "Brentwood, CA"}

ReviewContent: Some friends and I did some bar/food hopping on Shattuck after a beer festival last weekend. We stopped into Cornerstone and ordered the pork belly nachos...they were great! We didn't get any drinks since we had already had quite a few, but those nachos were fabulous. I'd love to go back and get them again someday! Service was good and quick too! They refilled our waters multiple times!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Jess M.", "AuthorLocation": "Concord, CA"}

ReviewContent: Came here for Sunday lunch. Service is really slow and food menu is very generic. And the so-called "live music" is just a DJ who is busy mixing some bass heavy random tunes better suites for night clubs. Not at all with the vibe of a craft beer and family&pet friendly hangout place.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Lisa L.", "AuthorLocation": "Albany, CA"}

ReviewContent: This review is for lunchtime only. I've not been there in the evenings or when there was a performance going on.If you want a wide selection of beer and beer like drinks and you are downtown berkeley this is where I would recommend. There are a couple of other places but this one has lots of room and an outside area you can sit. I tend to get smaller glasses of each so I can sample around more in a visit.I've had the fish and chips, and well, the fish and chips.  They are really good so I've had them three times now but I've also gone in with other folks for a smattering of other foods for the table and have not been disappointed.My one warning about this place, and the reason it gets three stars instead of four, is it is under staffed. Get a small crowd into the place and suddenly you are waiting around the bar to put in an order. They are good at tracking who is first, but it's still a lot of waiting.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Sean S.", "AuthorLocation": "San Ramon, CA"}

ReviewContent: Love this spot. I come by for happy hour every couple weeks. All pints (16oz pour options) are included in the happy hour pricing. The food is great, and we specially like the sausages and soft pretzel, but really everything is great. My wife really likes the salad. As far as venue, they have free live music often in the main dining and bar area, but the venue in the back is pretty legit too. Two floors with decent viewing upstairs. My biggest complaint is the bar set up for shows, but there isn't really any better place. Its a bit tough getting a drink and getting in and out of the venue room if you hit the main bar for drinks. The shows they have been getting are great, and we have only been to one, but expect to go to more in the future.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Neville V.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: The food here is great. And very diverse period, and very interesting too.  I haven't been to the music venue but I understand that the sound system in the lighting all pull together well. Is always crowded, and sometimes very hard to get a table,  especially if you just want to eat a. But, I always give it a try. And if there's no tail available like over to  la note.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Stephanie G.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: If you are looking for a place to enjoy your night with friends, here is a good option, you could go early to have some good food and stay longer for live music and DJ and artesanal beers!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Alejandra Y.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great venue for just about anything. If you're looking to watch sports, they have a lot of seating and several TVs. If you're looking to hang out with friends at night, they have a lot of great beers and pitchers that are well priced, as well as an outdoor area with seating and a firepit and a room in the back with ping pong, cornhole and other games (They also host concerts here!). My personal favorite beer is the Mango Wheat Beer, but most of the stuff I've tried there has been solid. I'm also a fan of the food as well. My personal favorite is the Vegetarian Chicken Tenders which are some of the best veggie meats I've had. It is very crispy on the outside and well made on the inside. I typically get the honey chipotle dipping sauce which is quite spicy and sour, but great tasting. The ranch is a bit too creamy for me, but also quite tasty and good to alternate with the honey chipotle. I also enjoy eating them with ketchup as well. I've also had the fries, pretzel, and hummus and like all of them. Overall, probably my favorite bar in Berkeley because it is classy, but affordable and fits nearly every occasion. Definitely will be coming back in the future!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Sampath D.", "AuthorLocation": "Brooklyn, NY"}

ReviewContent: Worst service I've had anywhere.   Sat for 15 minutes at the bar until the 1 of the 2 people working there even helped me.  All I wanted was a grilled cheese.  I come here cuz I work close by but this place is all show and no go!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Luciano B.", "AuthorLocation": "Sunol, CA"}

ReviewContent: I want to give this restaurant more stars. The beer selection is decent and the food is not too bad. Unfortunately they lack in good service. Went there last night and it was almost impossible to get a server to come to our table. We sat there for 15 minutes before receiving menus. When we did, it was because I had to grab a waitress running by. We then ordered food and proceeded to wait for an hour before the food arrived. We had tickets for the Berkeley rep and five minutes before the show the food still had not arrived. We informed our server know that we were in a bit of a hurry. We gave ourselves an hour and a half to have some beer and food and we still were not able to get our food in time. She ended up putting it in to go boxes and then gave us our check. No discounts given for the wait. I believe that she didn't put in our food order because we ended up asking another waitress about our food and she said that the order will be put in soon.  No apologies. I always feel bad when servers are shorthanded because it's not their fault however there is no excuse for poor service. Management needed to have at least two more servers working that night.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Chris C.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: Superb beer collection on tap. A beer for every person's taste. Spacious venue and outdoor patio. Great place to hang with friends. Would give a 5-star, but sometimes they are off their game when it comes to prompt service. Hopefully they'll get this dialed in.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Mack C.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Beautiful Venue! I love the fireside tables outside, concert area, and restaurant.  Good people working, friendly patrons, street parking available. Good experience all around. We only had drinks and attended a concert but the atmosphere was lovely
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Tiffany M.", "AuthorLocation": "Vallejo, CA"}

ReviewContent: Last night was the Bar Crawl for Berkeley Seniors - and although I don't go to Berkeley, I participated and had a really great time! I think this place was my favorite out of the three that we went to, only because it was well lit and relatively calm in comparison to the other areas. We all got Oski Pops (it might've been a special for just last night) - but they tasted great! I love the ambiance here and I love that they have a patio area.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Julia Y.", "AuthorLocation": "Upper West Side, Manhattan, NY"}

ReviewContent: Rachelle is a super friendly and knowledgeable bartender.  They have so many unique beer, cider and kombucha alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks to try it's amazing. They have happy hour Monday through Thursday from 3 to 6. They also have a cute patio out back with a fire pit. Next time I will try the Henley jalapeno cider I tasted it was really good. I liked the boochcraft kombucha, and unfortunately they ran out of the 101 Pineapple Cider so I'll try that next time too.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Michelle R.", "AuthorLocation": "Emeryville, CA"}

ReviewContent: Saw Saxon on Wednesday night. Incredible. Sound system was top flight. Hard hitting kick and bass. Well mixed vocals. Lighting was great too.  Not too blinding but really impactful. Clean place for a metal rock show.  Not too much beer on the floor for a full bar. Security was tight and respectful. Very professional. Take BART as the venue is right down the street. Very convenientTickets were $25. can't beat that!!Going to have dinner there next time
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Kevin C.", "AuthorLocation": "Danville, CA"}

ReviewContent: We came in really out of convenience. We were attending a concert and my wife just got off work and we drove straight to Berkeley from Stockton took forever to find somewhere to park so we couldn't really get anything to eat when I told my wife this is a restaurant! So we went straight in to the dining area and to say it was busy and a little noisy would be an understatement. Keep in mind this was a metal show. So we sat at the kind of bar stool area near the back and my wife flagged down the waitress that ended up helping us who was a very busy lady but a very calm look on her face and she proceeded to tell us that we could order something to eat right where we were and not have to wait for a table! Then she promptly brought us back two menus and beer list. And she came back and took our order. My wife had the basic All American Burger and an iced tea. I had the Cornerstone Burger and a lovely dank IPA whose name I cannot remember at the moment maybe it was pale white IPA or something like that. Anyway, complimentary water was brought immediately followed by drinks then dinner All in less than about 15 minutes. Now for the review of the food, excellent for the time we had I won't go into too much detail but I would come back here just to have a beer and have a burger. Extra special kudos go to the little lady was our waitress who just went out of her way to help us in an otherwise very busy restaurant. She was very cute and very gracious the rest of the wait staff was also prompt and courteous. The $10 tip I gave you was not enough thank you from the bottom of my heart from two weary travellers.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "David R.", "AuthorLocation": "Lakeview, Stockton, CA"}

ReviewContent: Awesome place to come on a Friday night with friends and family! Food was decent, beer was good, and live music was cool!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Krista B.", "AuthorLocation": "Castro Valley, CA"}

ReviewContent: I went here with friends for a drink after work on a Friday and ordered a pear cider and the house wine. Though the bar wasn't very busy because it was still only like 4PM, the service was REALLY slow. My friends and I waited at the bar for like 10 minutes even though the bar was practically empty, and some of the craft beers on the menu were fairly pricey compared to other local Berkeley pubs. I loved the atmosphere and open space of the bar, but I can't imagine ever going here during a time when it was busy.On the positive side, the drinks were tasty, it's group-friendly, and the queso on the nachos was divine. I just wouldn't recommend this place unless you're prepared for a long wait for your drinks.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Chelsey B.", "AuthorLocation": "Fremont, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great atmosphere, craft brew and food!  Server/bartender was just ok.. a better service would have made for a much better time.  Felt very rushed with order and he walked away In the middle of order..but I think maybe he was just having an off day.  We will definitely go back again when in the area. Overall..cool casual funky place to chill
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Lizz W.", "AuthorLocation": "Deltona, FL"}

ReviewContent: So spacious (and high ceilings)!!!!!!!! This is where Thalassa used to be, and I was shocked to see how different this place is from Thalassa!I love the occasional live music, the outdoor area, the other section with ping pong tables, cornhole, etc. The first time I came here though, there was a concert in the other section where there are normally ping pong tables, cornhole, etc... and we spontaneously went to the concert which was a unique experience because it was a genre of music I typically don't listen to. This place seemed to have a good number of Berkeley students and young professionals.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Annie S.", "AuthorLocation": "Los Angeles, CA"}

ReviewContent: Went here for a team event recently and loved the drinks menu, food and dessert! The fries, mac and cheese balls, burgers, pot pie, were all well received and the beer menu is impressive. They have a huge space with ping pong tables etc at the back.The only crappy incident was when our servers changed (or maybe we were being served by a nice manager/owner earlier and the server came in) midway through our visit and the new server wouldn't bring us anything until we agreed to open a new tab with her, which we thought was super rude and unnecessary and weird. We had to go get drinks from the bar from thereon even though we were getting service earlier because we wanted one tab.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Anju J.", "AuthorLocation": "San Mateo, CA"}

ReviewContent: really nice place, great spot for live music. very classy buiding and pleanty of room all around. The place is huge. I would go there again when someone i like is in town. seen shooter jennings there and it was a blast!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "John T.", "AuthorLocation": "Concord, CA"}

ReviewContent: This place is really happening. It gets loud but the music and the vibe are good. Drinks are strong. Snacks well... it's good cuz you will be drunk.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Byron L.", "AuthorLocation": "Los Gatos, CA"}

ReviewContent: Love this place!Live music, dinner, and drinks all get five stars from me.Bartenders, servers and security are awesome.Definitely worth checking out if your in Berkeley.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Jason S.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: The restaurant portion of this establishment is awesome, the menu is very diverse and features everything from pork belly nacho appetizers to full burger entrees; at prices that match their overall quality. Their beer selection is one of the best in the area, they have a massive wall of taps featuring many seasonal and longstanding favorites from around the state and are priced to compete. If you come to drink, be sure to grab a seat outside and take full advantage of their fire pit area, it definitely makes an evening more intimate.  The music venue portion of this establishment is great, although its a tad smaller than others in Berkeley, the floor layout provides an excellent view of performers, no matter where you stand. I like that there are two entrances into the venue, this helps shorten lines and brings customers on one end into the bar area while at the opposite end patrons are closer to merchandise tables. The bar inside the venue is not as well stocked as the restaurant, but they still have some tasty brews and mixed drinks being made by expert bartenders.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Joseph A.", "AuthorLocation": "San Jose, CA"}

ReviewContent: Server took 15 min to bring unopened champagne and glass. I think his name was Bob? After like 45 mins waiting for food, he blamed us for moving tables when he most likely forgot to put in our order because he was too busy flirting and socializing with other staff. Another waitress was cold when she brought us our drinks. Cool atmosphere tho
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Maren R.", "AuthorLocation": "Petaluma, CA"}

ReviewContent: Man oh man!! I went out to see Secrets at this bar which already was amazing to see, the bartenders Dani and Jordan were so sweet every time i went to see them. Plenty of samples and greats recommendations. I couldn't have felt more welcome! Thank you so much!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Gabriel H.", "AuthorLocation": "Downtown Berkeley, Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Awesome place. Very cool to hang out, watch sports, have drinks and just enjoy the mood around you. I tried their mac n cheese and it was amazing. I had such a great experience here the service was wonderful. I accidentally left my purse hanging under the bar and realized it a little after leaving. I called to ask about it and they told me they were hanging on to it for me. Nothing was missing Im happy to have an honest situation like that happen it truly is a great feeling of what could've been an unfortunate end to my day. Thank you! Live music is great I always enjoy going to places with live music, cornerstone definitely has a good feel and nice venue to enjoy the full experience. I would definitely come here again and recommend this place to others.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Noor A.", "AuthorLocation": "Walnut Creek, CA"}

ReviewContent: I rarely write reviews but had to say what an awesome experience my son and I had Sunday at a concert at Cornerstone!  I wasn't quite sure what to expect -- first time visiting -- but the staff, especially Pierce, was so welcoming and my son had "the best night ever!"  Great restaurant and venue!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Amy Z.", "AuthorLocation": "Lafayette, CA"}

ReviewContent: Motivated to write this review solely for the vegetarian chicken tenders. I've never had McNuggets so I don't know exactly what they should taste like but my carnivorous friend was so convinced he had to ask the waitress to make sure they hadn't messed up the order. I have to admit the texture is creepily meat like. Most fake meat I've had - even if the taste is right - the texture is off, but not this "chicken". Am truly impressed by the mad scientists who concocted this.As for the rest of the venue there is some nice outdoor seating with two fire pits. The music venue part is sort of upstairs and basically completely enclosed. There are many beers that seem relatively reasonably priced to me (around $6). There are plenty of TVs and a good amount of bar and regular table seating. The waits for tables seemed to be long in a Friday night but you are free to sit at the bar or stand while you wait. Overall, a great bar in downtown Berkeley. Would definitely return!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Jenny L.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Cornerstone is a solid bar. What sets it apart from other bars is its game area in the back. It isn't used as much as you'd think so you'll probably get your pick.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Nigel H.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: I fell in love with cornerstone at first sight. Many of you might remember the dive bar that used to be, but was shut down. Well they gutted it and turned it into the genius that is cornerstone. I'm obsessed with interactive games and cornerstone offers life size Jenga along with ping pong and other cool activities. The best part is the intimacy of the stage where there are love shows booked throughout the year. There is no bad view because it's really small. And there's a balcony you can get an eagles eye view of the stage. All the bartenders; excuse me, mixologist...they were super kind and quick!!! I didn't have to wait long for my order. And shortly afterwards I got my drink. There's plenty of seating and the option to lounge outside by the fire pit. Cornerstone can give off cool laid back vibes to let's shake it and turn up vibes. Zero to a hundred real quick. That's what I love about it! It facilitates whatever you're in the mood for! Even the food is good!They keep all things organized and it never gets crazy when I am there. I highly recommend seeing a concert here and play ping pong! It might turn into beer pong...who knows!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Alyssa E.", "AuthorLocation": "Sacramento, CA"}

ReviewContent: A much appreciated addition to Downtown Berkeley's bar scene! They have probably the most extensive craft beer tap list in Berkeley (rotating but kept updated on their website) and (I'm not sure how temporary this is with their relatively recent opening) their prices for most beers are great! In terms of food, their pulled pork burger was pretty top notch, and the pork belly nachos were decent. They seem to have quite a few concerts as well - someday I'm sure a band will draw me to attend one. I came here once on a night where there was not a concert & they had placed a couple ping pong tables and cornhole boards in the concert hall for common use - a great time for a group!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Thomas S.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: The variety of beers on draught, the friendliness and fun atmosphere, the excellent service from the bartender and the outdoor patio all combine to earn Cornerstone 4 stars. I celebrated a birthday here and it was great fun to go to the back and play cornhole, ping pong and giant jenga. There is a selection of very small craft brewers and local ones as well. Highly recommend the Allagash Curieux (from Maine!) which is aged in bourbon barrels!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Brendan H.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Amazing happy hour, dedicated staff, very accommodating and the vegetarian "chicken" tenders are incredible. Looking forward to making future visits!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Norman W.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: Could be a great place if they get it together.  Box office is screwed up, door people rude n if your going to pack them in like cattle at lease have a video system with screens everwhere.  Up stairs as well.  Go check out the Chapel in San Francisco to see how to do it right.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "David B.", "AuthorLocation": "Daly City, CA"}

ReviewContent: Came here with colleagues the other day and was such a blast! When you first walk in the first thing you will realize is that this place is significantly larger than it appears. There is the main seating area, an outdoor patio with fireplaces and a concert area. When there is no concert taking place, there is some games in that area. You go in and order at the counter and then pick your poison of where you want to sit. The beer selection was pretty good. A nice variety of local beers, mixed in with craft beers from elsewhere. One of our colleagues got fries and said they tasted good, but I can't attest to anything. Definitely will come back with other's to catch up, especially in the outdoor area.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Chris O.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: Cornerstone is so fun! Especially when they have live music. Pretty space. Great appetizers. Much better than bar food. Yummy burgers and appetizers. Definitely go here for a beer with your friends!! Great when they have live music because lots of dinner tables. Friendly staff.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Karina R.", "AuthorLocation": "Salt Lake City, UT"}

ReviewContent: I haven't been here since Thalassa, I think is a good place to come and have some fun if you don't have anyone to take care of your kids or if you have some under age friends since is all age friendly. in the other hand I think it does need more bartenders since it gets really packed and the wait to get a beer is about 10-15 min which is pretty dam long. live music is ok I will prefer less light and a DJ rather than live music( personal opinion)
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Andres I.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Dear Alex (Owner):I am Ray Choulett's wife and we know you from Pappy's- I wanted to let you know that we went to see "Petty Theft" (Tom Petty cover band) last night, first time for either of us there.  The band was fantastic and we really had a great time and enjoyed the bar, the drinks were great, just wanted to point out a few things that you should be aware of.People were spilling drinks on the floor all night which honestly created a hazard.  I was wearing Uggs and almost slipped and fell more than a few times.  I think if you had more chairs/tables around the perimeter that might make a difference- there really weren't enough places for us old folks to sit.  You had more than a few elderly guests (probably in their 70's-80's) that were looking for a place to sit and watch the show.  We are planning to attend both Zoso and Moustache Harbor and will be calling the venue to see if we can bring our own camp chairs with us.In any case, remembering Berkeley's "Keystone" and "Ruthies" I am happy that we now have a venue close enough to go hear some great live music, thank you for that.  I will update my 3-star for a 5-star when I see an effort for more seating and a policy of no drinks on the dance floor (somebody's going to get hurt).:) - Cory Gaeta Choulett
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Corinne G.", "AuthorLocation": "Albany, CA"}

ReviewContent: Incredible service! No wait to be seated, prices are affordable. Food is so yummy, we put our order in and basically no wait at all! The food came out within 5 min of ordering, nice and hot! Really nice atmosphere with awesome service. Highly recommend. Will be back!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Stephanie K.", "AuthorLocation": "Tacoma, WA"}

ReviewContent: Awesome service and delicious food and reasonable prices. Very fun, yet relaxing, atmosphere. They have live music in the restaurant/bar on some nights and also have a venue that is in a separate part of the building that hosts great bands and artists. Will definitely visit again! Thanks cornerstone!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Trevor S.", "AuthorLocation": "Ashland, OR"}

ReviewContent: Great selection of beers on tap. Awesome that they host many live events of various interests.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Howard L.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: Not only are they are bar, but they serve food and act as a concert venue. I haven't been to this place since it's been Thalassa, the pool hall. Obviously, this place got remodeled and looks much more spacious. There's an outdoor patio with some fire pits which is a nice touch. TVs everywhere so good place to go to watch sports. The backroom is filled with 2 ping pong tables, cornhole, and big connect four. They start giving out wristbands at 10PM, don't fully understand why. Our waitress was friendly and had a variety of colored pens to choose from when she brought us our check which was fun! I gave this place 3 stars after some friends ordered from their menu. Although this place is good for sports games and casual drinking, based on the pictures I posted, their food didn't look appeasing. Believe it or not, the tomato soup was served like that! The grilled cheese sandwich was basic to say the least! Anyone can peel off Kraft cheese square and slap it on some bread, toast it, and call it grilled cheese. Needless to say that my friends were beyond disappointed with their meals and probably would never order from here again.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Jenna T.", "AuthorLocation": "Hercules, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great atmosphere with games to play, LOW priced food (thank you), tons of beer options, and a full bar. I love the modern feel, and I find this to be exactly what Berkeley needs. Some further staff management could be appropriate.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Scott M.", "AuthorLocation": "The Loop, Chicago, IL"}

ReviewContent: Had tickets to see a band here and decided to eat and have a couple beers as well. I think they've done a great job of combining a live music venue with a bar/tap room that serves good food. Really liked the vegetarian options, "chicken" nuggets were delicious and so was the tofu sandwich. They were out of the beer I wanted , but still a good selection. Service was nice but our waitress was hard to find most of the night. Fun night overall. Will definitely come back.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Erin L.", "AuthorLocation": "Martinez, CA"}

ReviewContent: How long does someone have to stand at the bar with money showing to get any service!? Clearly forever then you leave! Wtf there are like 6 bartenders or more and not one acknowledged us! That's just plane bad service!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Lisa M.", "AuthorLocation": "Pleasanton, CA"}

ReviewContent: I used to come here when it was thalassa! While I miss thalassa a bunch, I like what this place turned into. One part of it is a bar and restaurant and there's another room for live shows. They also have an outdoor area. It's a pretty big space. I recently caught a Sammy J show and enjoyed myself. They have a good selection of craft beer if you're into that. Haven't tried the food, but I wouldn't mind coming here to catch another show and grabbing food and drinks before.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Anita W.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: Stay away from the salads. I ordered the kale and butternut squash salad -- squash still was partially frozen. My friend ordered the kale caesar which was a pile of raw kale leaves with toppings. So disappointing for a bar with awesome  outdoor seating, fire pits, and a solid drink menu!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Pauline S.", "AuthorLocation": "Santa Barbara, CA"}

ReviewContent: Nice interior. Good vibe. Would like to come back and hear some music. Food was good. Great place to stop for a drink! A little college-y.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "S B.", "AuthorLocation": "East Hampton, NY"}

ReviewContent: Great beer, burgers, and vibes. It's also a lot of fun whenever there's live music! It can get really packed on the weekends but I've never had to wait longer than 5 minutes to be seated.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Keeley S.", "AuthorLocation": "Goleta, CA"}

ReviewContent: Can't believe this place used to be Thalassa! It's such a spacious place now! I came here on a Saturday Night and there was a good amount of people there, but still places to sit. There's patio area with big fire pits and even a mini venue for concerts. They also have a live band that performs on Saturday nights. It's definitely a great place for large groups of people. I love how they have a full menu, but they also have good side beer foods. The Pork Belly Nachos were tastey, but could have used more chips.Overall, this is a cool place to chill and catch up with friends all while drinking and eating dinner.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Meliza M.", "AuthorLocation": "Alameda, CA"}

ReviewContent: Cool place with plenty of space, tv's, beers and a cool patio with huge fire pits.  There was a decent DJ when I went on a Friday night with a few people dancing.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Kieron S.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great beer, great Saturday night DJ! I have also been here during the early evening for a warriors game. Great spot to hang out!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Olivia B.", "AuthorLocation": "Lafayette, CA"}

ReviewContent: First stop on my buddies bachelor party pub tour. Definitely more modern and trendy. The brick interior lends itself to the city vibe along with the outdoor area. Let's start with the beer. First of all, our waitress was very accommodating as she let us try many beers before selecting the pitcher we would start with. We started with a light beer from a brewery in Davis called Sudwerk. Tasty and an easy drinker.We then moved on to a darker porter from San Diego. They also feature many local breweries in Berkeley and Oakland.The main dining room had plenty of tv's and we enjoyed the Saturday college football lineup.  But after awhile our competitive juices were flowing and so we headed into their concert room. Here they have a couple ping pong tables set up along with a couple corn hole set ups.  Lastly, the food was very good. I had the barbecue bacon cheeseburger and it was excellent. Cooked to the medium well perfection that I requested.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Brock G.", "AuthorLocation": "Martinez, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great vibes at this place. Cornerstone is fun fun fun.If you are trying to have fun and drink cornerstone has fun and drink. I have thrice wanted fun and drink and ventured into cornerstones venue. And, I experienced fun then drink.But really though, get there to play games, see live music and drink.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Austin C.", "AuthorLocation": "Fremont, CA"}

ReviewContent: I live in the neighborhood and am not a college student. I had really high hopes for this bar as a place to watch sports, especially Sunday football given that they have about 5+ giant flat screen TV's hanging from the walls..that is definitely not the case. On two Sunday visits, the bar was quiet and not very busy, and while football was on the screens, there was no sound. Instead they were playing jazz/r&b (think Bill Withers) at a barely audible volume. So I can't imagine it was for ambiance..also, the bartenders looked somewhat unhappy to be there..I'm sure the focus is on live music and an overall nightlife experience, but again given the "sports bar" feel and the fact that it's open during the day, it's a bit misleading.I know its a new place, and it takes time to iron out the wrinkles, but I hope you figure it out soon. Overall, its a great looking space.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Joe T.", "AuthorLocation": "Salt Lake City, UT"}

ReviewContent: I was looking for a place to chill with beer post concert in Downtown Berkeley. I decided to try my luck at Jupiter but decided to give this place a go. It looked insanely huge from the outside and I wasn't disappointed upon stepping in . Amazing beer selection (they even had a couple of Gose and Sour beers) and they have a nice patio as well as booth for a perfect chilling experience. I'm glad I came to this place and would definitely bring more of my friends here.Do give this place a try if you want an alternative to Jupiter.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Pranav B.", "AuthorLocation": "Santa Clara, CA"}

ReviewContent: Cute little hipster place. Food was decent, i ordered a plain burger with cheese, they forgot my cheese and added a mayo butter sauce to my burger. The mac n cheese ball was really good.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Steph V.", "AuthorLocation": "Fremont, CA"}

ReviewContent: Been here twice. The first time, I didn't think my drink was great, but really loved my friend's drink. The second time I came and got it (The Captain's Boutonniere) and yup, still good. Also helps that it is the cheapest cocktail. Food is pretty standard bar grub (burgers, mac and cheese balls, salads, nachos). Wouldn't really come here for it.  Service is a little weird in that you have to wait to be seated even if you just want drinks. The inside is a little noisy which is often the case with live music (which was really good). Patio is nice, but not really too exciting. Interesting mixture of twenty year olds and families. Solid place to hang out!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Eric Z.", "AuthorLocation": "Torrey Highlands, San Diego, CA"}

ReviewContent: nice open spacious place, nice bar, lots of beers.  Outside seating  was nice, well designed place.  Good spot to hang out with a friend and chill after work, many places to find a corner or be in the middle of it all if you want. Our server Anya was great  fast  polite!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "JASON C.", "AuthorLocation": "Pinole, CA"}

ReviewContent: Very spacious and hip! I loved that they had sports playing on multiple TV screens and the noise level was still so low. I didnt get to see the live band but the outdoor seating was super cool! It had really pretty firepits you can sit next to, and you can see indoors because it is all glass or just open space.The workers were super chill and helpful (felt like they didnt smile much but thats not too important :p) And most importantly they had really good beer YAAASThey were out of one of the beers we wanted to drink but they let us try a few before we decided on one. Super chill bar! Definitely want to go back.I wanted something sweet so ordered a cinnamon roll but it wasnt that good. Kind of made me question if they made it or just bought a batch from costco and warmed it up LOLbut it was what i could get at a bar so i wont complain teeheeoverall, i loved it!! im going back next time im in berkeley!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Yeonhwa S.", "AuthorLocation": "Hayward, CA"}

ReviewContent: I came in here with my boyfriend after a stroll for a quick bite and drink. Our server was a lovely lady named Michelle. She was quite attentive and tended to our every need. Everything from the food to the drinks and especially the service was spectacular. We will definitely be back and hopefully we can catch Michelle when she's working, she's fantastic!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Lisa K.", "AuthorLocation": "Pinole, CA"}

ReviewContent: I am super excited about this spot. I went here the other day with a friend and sat in the outdoor sitting area in the back. This place is a lot of things put into one huge space. There is bar and table sitting up front, a lounge area in the middle with couch sitting and the back patio area(with a firepit!!)I am definitely coming back, This is the perfect spot to take a big group of friends. I only knocked down one star cause the service was pretty slow. My friend and I had to wait for quite awhile for just a simple order of fries. Definitely will re-review the service once I return. Ah, I love Berkeley.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Cynthia G.", "AuthorLocation": "Los Angeles, CA"}

ReviewContent: Good beer and venue, but horrible service on a Sunday afternoon. There was one bartender for the whole place and no waitresses.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Erica A.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: The service was horribly slow and the staff were rude when asking questions about the beer selection. What was even worse was their food. Wouldn't recommend this place to anyone especially with other great places to go in Berkeley.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Ever V.", "AuthorLocation": "Tallahassee, FL"}

ReviewContent: Definitely a nice open space that's good for groups and if you like beer. Two stars off for food and service. Hopefully both can improve! First staff was confused about happy hour. We were told it was until 7pm by two different people but then our server told us there is no happy hour on fridays. He should have mentioned that when we explicitly ordered our drinks from the happy hour menu. They adjusted the bill though. Second the snacks we ordered were mediocre. Both the "roasted" brussel sprouts and "seared" cauliflower needed both more roasting and searing, they were pretty raw. Dipping sauces were runny and not memorable. Hummus was not too bad but again nothing exciting. Would definitely go back for the space though and perhaps the main dishes would better.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Nitya V.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: Happened upon this place by chance.  Ordered the all-American burger and fries and a pilsener.  The burger was among the best I've had.  The meat was juicy and it came on a delicious bun.  What a pleasant surprise.  And the fries were perfect - thick cut, soft on the inside, crispy on the outside, but not greasy.  All for just $9, not exactly McDonalds but a bargain by today's fancy burger-place prices.  Beer was fine too (I'm not a big beer drinker), and they had a very large list of options. If you're looking for a great burger and you're close by - you should eat here.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Marc S.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: I'm bumping up my 3 star to a 4 star! Why you ask? I went to my first show there tonight and it was great! The room with the stage is a good size, but still intimate like the Great American Music Hall. The show was sold out, but it didn't feel over crowed. There's also a balcony that wraps around the floor. The drinks are cheap, there's no credit card minimum, the sound quality is good, a nice mix group of people, and it's so close to BART. I highly recommend coming here for a show.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Vanessa S.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: This place has an awesome vibe, good live music friendly staff. The food here is really good, there is inside seating and outside I sat outside and must say sitting outside with your food and drinks is a chill vibe and relaxing. We had mixed drinks they were ok, we didn't have beers so can't speak on that but given the name I'm sure the beers are amazing.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Paul J.", "AuthorLocation": "San Jose, CA"}

ReviewContent: Super rude service and the DJs were TERRIBLE. Asked us to leave for requesting a song. Hello, you're a DJ?!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Gigi B.", "AuthorLocation": "Poughkeepsie, NY"}

ReviewContent: I've been here a few times, each time giving the benefit of the doubt and hopeful for a better experience, but to no avail. Staff is horribly rude and the food isn't ever worth $10+, their burgers come out limp and cold. They preach an extensive list of craft beer on tap, but they always seem to be out of many.The final straw came when i was grabbing a drink with my friend after work. Bartender made a comment about us both being asian girls and the number of beers it would take us to turn red. Like was this his way of trying to hit on us? I dont' get it.I made a yelp account specifically to leave this bad review, I have never been so turned off and disgusted from my experience at a business.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "M K.", "AuthorLocation": "Albany, CA"}

ReviewContent: Was at this bar recently with friends, the bartender was rude and made me feel extremely uncomfortable. HARD PASS
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Kate C.", "AuthorLocation": "Grand Prairie, TX"}

ReviewContent: Honestly, was really disappointed by this place. Went last week as I was looking for a fun place to grab some beers in the east bay, and was greeted with the worst drinking experience I've had in months. Servers were inattentive and slow - pretty sure the dude I got drinks from had an attention span shorter than a goldfish. Wish I could leave a 0 star review
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Abraham S.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: I have never felt more harassed in Berkeley in my entire life. The audacity to call their establishment "upscale" is much closer to a mask of elitism that isn't welcomed in an environment of unity and tolerance. Not only were my friends and I given rude service, but obviously targeted for not appearing like their "ideal" clientele. Apparently the understanding that young, employed, college educated people can appear in any way regardless of clothing, race, or sexual preference has not made it to cornerstone. I hope they evolve, if not for the sake of themselves as people, then at least for their business.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Christian A.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: Happy Hour lasts and lasts at Cornerstone--all the way until 7pm, with $2 off pints! Pro tip: If a beer is available to order in a pitcher, it is applicable for the Happy Hour Special. I've come here twice now for Happy Hour with my coworkers and have loved it both times. If you get here right around 5pm after work, it'll only be starting to fill--a half hour later, this place will be rolling! This is a great place to go if you have a large group--lots of space for standing, and there are several long, communal tables for big groups of friends. It also feels very clean, polished, and organized. While it feels a little upscale, I love the unpretentious air this place has. Their craft-filled beer menu regularly changes based on availability, and is organized into the categories of Hoppy, Dark, Light, Tart/Sour, Specialty/Other, Cider, and Bottles/Cans.  There are at least three or four beers per category, and sometimes nine or ten.  With the menu set up this way, you can take a risk ordering a brew you haven't had before, as you already know that you like a certain type of beer. The servers have always been nice about letting me try beers before ordering them, though. Not to mention, the Specialty/Other section gives you unique beverages like alcoholic root beers or kombucha to order if you feel like having something a little different or "out there."The last time I came here, we had a large group sit outside in the back patio area.  I was really impressed that when more of our party arrived, some folks that worked at Cornerstone helped push tables together to accommodate us. The outdoor seating area is nice, and like the interior there's plenty of space to avoid feeling cramped. What I'm not big on is the food. The pork belly nachos were interesting, but uninspiring; the fries, nothing to write home about; pan-seared cauliflower, fine, but the spicy aioli was bland. With three swings and three misses, I'll stick to drinks here--though I'll admit, the sandwiches have looked pretty good.This is a great place to go with a group of friends for a pre-dinner drink. I'd love to come here for some live music sometime.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Steph M.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Accessibility here is clearly a priority. The staff was super friendly and accommodating and didn't blink when we asked for what we needed. More venues should take note from their example! I would give 10 stars if I could for an incredible experience.We bought tickets for the Fastball show as soon as they went on sale and I called the venue later that day to ask about accessibility. My sister preferred not to take a mobility aid if possible so we were just wondering what the layout was and whether we could have a seat somewhere and still see the show. The first time I called, I got someone who wasn't sure, but told me to call back during weekday daytime hours to speak to a manager. I put it off because I was so sure it was going to be terrible like every other concert venue we've ever tried to go to.But NO! I finally talked to Jennie (sp?) earlier this week and when I asked about accessibility she asked what we needed and didn't pause to think or ask insulting questions - she just told me to ask for Cory (again, sorry if I'm mispelling names! Please correct me because these employees deserve proper kudos!) at the box office when we arrived and they'd take care of us and make sure we got seating with a view of the stage. That I should feel free to drop her name since she wouldn't be there (it wasn't necessary as everyone was immediately helpful). Right away we felt more at ease and even more excited to see our favorite band in concert at a small venue!We arrived a little early so we got to eat in the restaurant next door. They do allow you to take food into the concert area (so later I finished my kale and butternut squash salad with a plastic fork while sitting on the floor) - just no glass (reasonable). There's a bar inside for ordering drinks in non-glassware. The fries and avocado burger were really good and the kale salad was a little sweet, but really tasty. Service was friendly and very fast (have seen other complaints that it was slow and we were worried about that, but didn't experience it). Also, this place is new and very clean (including bathrooms).I asked Katie (sp?) at the box office for Cory as Jennie advised and she told me to talk to any security guard and they would make sure we got a seat, even if all the seating on the sides were taken. She texted the main security guard, TJ, and gave me a description of him so we could look for him specifically. Again, immediately put at ease, going above and beyond the information, super friendly and welcoming.We packed up our meal and got into the concert part of Cornerstone soon after doors opened at 7:30. There was a row of chairs on both sides of the stage. I figured we'd just sit on the side, but we weren't sure if we'd be able to see over people standing in the center. Figuring it wouldn't hurt to ask, we found TJ (such a nice guy!) and asked if we could pull a chair in front of the stage. He said go for it, just watch for elbows and find him if anyone gave us any problems. What?! Front row seat? To be fair, I stayed standing (I didn't need the accommodation and didn't want to take a seat from someone else who might need one) and my sister pulled up her chair. We laughed and felt silly, but also knew this was going to be one of the best concert experiences because we could be up by the band where we wanted to be, weren't going to be in anyone's way, wouldn't have to worry about people standing up in front of us, and could experience the show together. It was beyond amazing. It didn't get fully packed so no elbows went flying near her head, but other people were singing and dancing all around us. She was able to get up and dance for brief periods of time. I got to be with my happy, present sister and not taken away from the enjoyment of the show because she was in pain that could have been prevented by better accommodation (our experience by the end of every other concert).Accessibility here was what it should be - smooth, painless, and reasonable. We were treated with respect and made to feel just as welcome as any other patron. No special treatment - just what was necessary to enjoy the experience and want to come back. It was easy to give, after all. Still, it is far too rare. So if you're disabled and want to see a concert, come here! It's a great venue, has friendly awesome staff, good food and drinks, and a fun ambiance. I'm coming back for the fire pit in the back and the desserts if not for another show asap.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Shawna S.", "AuthorLocation": "Atlanta, GA"}

ReviewContent: So I am here with friends and everyone was having a good time until one of the waiters came and asked me to take my hoodie off. I was wearing it because I was cold sitting outside and was obviously caught off guard when the waiter told me that it's a policy they have. I took it off and looked around, there was a bunch of guys with baseball caps and one guy with a cowboy hat but apparently, the policy only applies to hoodies. I guess head wear is only threatening when it's a hoodie. When we asked the security guard what's this policy about, listen to this: they tell us "because people in hoodies come and steal" !!!!!!! after trying to talk out the situation and explain the ban was racially motivated, he looked shocked, completely disagreed, and said it is not and that the ban is also on grills- as though that is not MORE RACIST. We continued talking to him and he had the nerve to say it is not blatant racism but instead implied racism. Unfortunately, although the food, music, and drinks were good, my friends and I cannot tolerate this bullshit in Berkeley and will not be coming back.Update: Just adding an update in response to the owner whose suggesting I am imagining or that I and about 8 other people are stupid. I am not interested in dragging this longer. But I want anyone reading to know, that I know what I and a group of us saw and heard. The guy that asked me to take my hoodie down may or may not have been a waiter or a server, he might've been a security guy, it doesn't matter. He was dressed in all black and he did not shy away from giving us his name. After I was ordered to take my hoodie down, my husband and I also went on to the bar and asked for a manager, we talked to a bartender (who was behind the bar with others so not an imposter) and when he said manager was on a break (supposedly) we asked again if banning hoodies was a policy, he said yes.. we asked why he said that it was for people's safety in case of trouble .. I am not sure what that meant but to give the guy the benefit of the doubt, I asked why are hats and caps not banned too then, he had nothing to say. We asked him to convey the message to the manager and owner. We also talked to the guy himself who asked me to take my hoodie down (the conversation from the earlier post) and another staff member who I believe may have been a server, so 3 different staff members who to be clear we asked were not external contractors. If you think you had 3 different imposters in your business at the same time - I would be really worried. What you're saying is laughable but I think you got the message, so instead of denying I would fix your own personal prejudices and your establishment's policy instead of blaming your poor staff who are only trying to earn a living.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Mira N.", "AuthorLocation": "Albany, CA"}

ReviewContent: The place was nice, roomy and airy. My sister and I tried it out today. We both ordered burgers and although we were told the fries were cut fresh then frozen, neither of us believed that. Those fries were definitely frozen...not fresh cut. The burger was good.I originally ordered a lemon drop with Tito's Homemade Vodka, but I watched the drink being made and never saw the Tito's in the bartenders hand. It was watered down, but sweet from the sugared rim, so I exchanged it for a mimosa which was marginal at best. People, I ask you, how does one mess up a mimosa? There is nothing to it!When the bill arrived the lemon drop had not been removed from the tab. Once removed and bill paid. The change back was incorrect as $6 was missing. Are we tipping ourselves without consulting these days? I think NOT.Would I go back? Not sure I'm finished or if I'm done.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Ruth L.", "AuthorLocation": "Emeryville, CA"}

ReviewContent: I'm not usually one to give good reviews for 2 reasons.1) I've thought most positive reviews were done by friends of the ownership.2) I simply don't take the time.Well, I was very impressed with how spacious, how pleasant and quick the service is in the dining area. After we ate a quick bite, we headed into the music venue with its own bar and quick bartenders. We were there to see Shaggy and once again we were impressed with the sound system and diversity of the crowd of all ages.I look forward to going again soon.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "John V.", "AuthorLocation": "Walnut Creek, CA"}

ReviewContent: Like the Vibe and layout.....but (most) Bartenders have to speed it up a bit. OK, my bad, ordering a Manhattan at a Beer-centric place like this.....what was I thinking?
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "John S.", "AuthorLocation": "Walnut Creek, CA"}

ReviewContent: I stopped by about an hour and half before closing to grab a drink with a coworker after a long week. It's Friday night, and the place wasn't too packed. The crowd definitely consisted of nearby college students. Loud music was playing and it was hard to have a conversation. The wait staff was really attentive and worked quick. Bartenders worked quick as well. Lots of seating either indoor or outdoor in the back.I really liked their wall of drinks on tap. I forgot the name of my drink but it contained pumpkin. It was a tiny bit sour with a hint of pumpkin. It was good and something new. I'd really give them a 3.5 stars. The beer selection is great but the crowd kind of draws me out.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Teri C.", "AuthorLocation": "Rodeo, CA"}

ReviewContent: Loved the atmosphere: 5/5. This place boasts a modern yet rustic feel and I like that it easily accommodates larger parties given that (1) they have one long booth, and (2) there's plenty of space for quick re-engineering. I came here with a group of Cal+ students, and the party grew to upwards of 25, if not more. We fit comfortably. You can also select from apparently Berkeley's largest selection of beers on tap. I ordered the evil twin, which was this very dark chocolate-y, rather bitter stout. Quite delicious and a solid 4/5.I unfortunately only got the appetizer (vegetarian chicken tenders, 3/5 at most), which I found underwhelming, so the next time I come here I'm going for the tofu sandwich since that looked yummy.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Julia Y.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: I was first brought to this bar at the beginning of the summer and fell in love with the place, they have tons of beer on tap and of course liquor. I bring all of my friends/visitors to this bar because of how much light and space there is. There are also games in the back.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Roger M.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Cool place with fun games in the back and reasonable prices. The beer selection is also awesome. We sent out kids off to the game / music venue area while we enjoyed our beer on a lazy Saturday.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Mark C.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: Service sucked, except for the man picking up the dishes ...he was the most attentive and really nice and kept checking on us!!!! But food was ok. The atmosphere is chill ... it's very clean. But the service was honestly super disappointing. They didn't serve us water till 10 mins later. They had no idea of the beer we were looking for. It was just ok honestly.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Jane W.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: It's times like these I really wish there were half-stars to give on yelp, but I will err on the side of 4 star for the vast tap selection, especially having three ciders and a handful of sours.I came here on a Tuesday evening this week with coworkers for happy hour and noticed that the happy hour here isn't really very helpful, unless you like cocktails, as it doesn't seem to cover food or very many of the taps; of those that are available as 10oz./16oz./pitcher, you can order a 16oz. for the price of a 10oz. ($2 off).The place looked pretty empty (but it is also pretty massive for downtown Berkeley) so the waitstaff was really attentive, and checked back in with those of us still deciding (I and one other arrived a little behind) without feeling pressuring or naggy. They were great about refilling our water glasses regularly too.I started with a mixed-fermentation sour beer by Paradox Brewery, Skully #50 "Strawbasil" (10oz. $12, 7.7%) and midway through enjoying it (and enjoy it, I sure did!) I ordered the deconstructed smoked pulled pork sandwich, which is $12, not $9 as the menu online shows. Their menu last night included the MAINS section (no longer coming soon) and it looks like prices changed too. That kind of irks me, but I bought what I bought. The sandwich says it comes with vinaigrette slaw, barbeque sauce, mayonnaise, and a sweet French roll, and while delicious, there was nothing deconstructed about this sandwich, unless they meant that the slaw and sauce were outside the sandwich? But that's how I'd prefer it anyway. I'm realizing now there was no mayonnaise, but that's probably for the best. It also came with a big cup of fries that were toasty warm (not too hot for me) and fluffy (not too crispy dry). The sandwich was pretty big and came with a bowl of slaw that I actually really enjoyed! I was expecting it to be too vinegar-y but it was really balanced and fresh, to complement the smoky, umami pork and tangy-sweet barbeque sauce.My coworkers all seemed really content with their meals. One had a margarita she said was very strong, and was happy with the Cornerstone Burger ($12) that comes with pulled pork and mac & cheese balls ON THE BURGER; honestly I kind of wish I'd pulled the trigger and ordered that for myself. I tried a bite of another's pork belly nachos (to determine if I wanted my own) and they were pretty yummy, but the white cheddar sauce was a little too creamy and not enough cheesy for my taste. I really like the build your own board trend, and that'll be my order next-time I'm here. One coworker got the vegetarian chicken tenders and said the waitress was right in her appraisal of them as "they look, taste, feel, chew just like real chicken tenders."I ordered a second drink, a cider by Golden State with light flavors of spearmint and lemongrass, appropriately named Le Mint (10oz. $7, 7.5%) and it took a little longer to come out, presumably since it had gotten a little busier.I should note during our meal, one of my coworkers realized that he'd been given a 10oz. beer but had ordered a 16 (that should have been included in the happy hour special pricing). The "fix" they offered was a free beer/drink, which was fine for us - he happily ordered a third but if he hadn't wanted another, someone else in the group would have taken the opportunity - but if it was a smaller group, that might not have been ideal. Another server also brought out a free beer offered to anyone in our group who wanted it. That was a nice touch I thought, since we were a decent sized group there for a while (and giving them a bit of money).When the check came, they had included an 18% gratuity even though our group was only 7 (the menu says included for groups of 10 or more). Not a big deal but a little detail. Once we'd calculated who was putting how much on their card, taking care of the check was quick work.The restrooms are clean but I feel like when there's a musical guest, they get crowded. Berkeley is kind of a parking nightmare. Be careful you don't walk past the place since there's no big name on the front (apparently the previous tenant didn't have that either).Overall, I'm really happy with the selection of taps here and I'm sure I'll be back to enjoy more ciders and sours, with or without food.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Keridwyn R.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Fantastic food, an incredible selection and balanced array of craft beers, and a fantastic sounding music venue! My only slight complaint is that the beer selection in the club is super basic. Is it possible to bring a few craft beers over to the club side? It seems the licensing might be separate, but is the purchasing separate too?
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Pollen H.", "AuthorLocation": "Vallejo, CA"}

ReviewContent: Well I guess I can't really review this place's beer on the account of being refused service. My girlfriend and I came in from Seattle with Washington State driver's licenses and they said they were fake and wouldn't let us order a beer. The bartender even showed her manager and he couldn't determine that they were real. When I asked why they didn't scan them, the bartender replied that they didn't have one of those devices. I'm sorry, but you can't call yourself a bar and not be able to tell the difference between a real and a fake ID in a COLLEGE TOWN BAR.Will only be going to Jupiter from now on when visiting my alma matter.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Austin Z.", "AuthorLocation": "Seattle, WA"}

ReviewContent: This place is a wonderful new addition to Berkeley. It somehow manages to do it all, great craft beer, beer garden, food, and a concert venue all in one? Yup. I came in the first time with a group of work friends for happy hour, we loved the cocktails. I came back when they launched their food menu to test it out and it did not disappoint. The owner's wife developed these build your own meat, cheese, veggie boards that are perfect for a group appetizer. The last time I went, I had a broken leg and I wanted to try it out as a concert venue. I brought my husband to see George Clinton for his birthday. It was an incredible evening. The owner went out of his way to accommodate my broken leg and my husband had an amazing birthday because of his hospitality. Can't say enough good things about this place. Check it out for dinner/apps/drinks before music! Thank you for opening this spot in Berkeley, Alex!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Carole L.", "AuthorLocation": "El Cerrito, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great beer selection. Staff has zero customer service as well as the security. Waiting to order drinks the two servers/bartenders where busy talking about how much they dislike working there. Then they called last call at 12:30 when it says they close at 2 am, and then served us drink, then 5 minutes later told us we had 5 minutes to leave. WHACK
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Betty A.", "AuthorLocation": "Emeryville, CA"}

ReviewContent: I wish the space to play table tennis and other games was prettier. Oakland has better place for beer and has outside place which is pretty cute. They have good selection of beer but some workers didn't know what's there haha
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Katie T.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: I noticed that Cornerstone was hosting some relatively big-name acts, and I jumped at the chance to see George Clinton and Parliament/Funkadelic there. The place itself seems nice enough. Walking into the music venue in the back I was impressed and happy that such a place existed in Berkeley.But then the show started. The sound was AWFUL. Every frequency was muddled. Vocals cut in and out. Every instrument distorted. This might have been the fault of the group's own sound person, but as someone who once managed a live venue, I know that it's up to the hosts to law down the law when it comes to sound. And rule #1 is: NO RED LIGHTS on the mixer. I tried wearing earplugs for a couple of songs, but it was still unbearable. I'm not going to ruin my ears just to listen to an unlistenable show. I can't imagine returning to this venue.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Currently A.", "AuthorLocation": "Noord, Amsterdam, The Netherlands"}

ReviewContent: Been wanting to check out this spot for a while. I mean it couldn't be a better concept. The place looks great the design is just right for the space. Unfortunately what stood out more than the great design was the fact that we had a hard time finding a place to sit because so many tables were filled with dirty dishes, silverware and glassware. The beer selection was good plenty of styles to choose from. Nice they offer pitchers but with so many good beers offering flights would be a nice additionWe had some apps and they were average at best. Mac and cheese bites are presented well but nothing outstanding as far as flavor goes. The vegetarian chicken nuggets were a good size but again nothing outstanding. Sauces taste mass produced straight from the big plastic jug with cafeteria style carrots and celery as garnish. Pretty cheap so I guess you get what you pay for.What mostly made me give this place two stars was the bartender who fulfilled the requirements of serving us foods and drinks. However failed 100% at making us feel welcome or even giving us the perception that she gave two sh*ts about getting our business. I honestly don't care if she actually gives a f*ck about our business but she could have done a much better job of faking it. So owners managers if you give a sh*t as opposed to most industry people who read these and say well f*ck that dude maybe you could have people working who care about the appearance of your awesome space and could try to make guest believe they are valued.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Gary R.", "AuthorLocation": "Elk Grove, CA"}

ReviewContent: A very welcome addition to DT Berkeley!!!  This is the old Thalassa space, and while I do miss the kitschy mermaid vibe, this spot is awesome! So much more spacious and airy, with tons of seating at the long bar, as well as couches, and low and high top tables inside, as well as the outdoor patio in back (with fire pits for chilly nights!)I had lunch here early afternoon on a Saturday- there were a decent amount of folks at the bar and some tables, but it was relaxed and chill.
