It gets much busier at night, especially on show nights.The food was fantastic! Gastropub style with high quality ingredients. Nice selection of salads, sandwiches, burgers, and entrees, with a few desserts. A very nice selection of apps and shared bites - everything from charcuterie to nachos. I had the pulled pork sandwich, and it was absolutely delish! The pork was super juicy - not dry at all. And, I loved that they served the sandwich "deconstructed" - the BBQ sauce, mayo, and slaw were all on the side, so you can add just the right amount of everything to your own liking. The BBQ sauce was really flavorful!! Oh, and I loved the homemade pickle slices on the side, too. Fries were also excellent!Just be aware, during the slower daytime hours, there are no servers on the floor, so if you plan to eat, just order at the bar and grab a table. The bartender will bring your food out to you.If you are a wheelchair user, there are a number of low- top tables over in the front by the windows, as well as in the back by the patio entrance. I do wish the seating was a bit more integrated, with less high-tops.I didn't have any libations on my first visit, but there is a full bar and lots of beer on tap. A perfect spot for a few drinks and a nibble or for a full meal - I will be back very soon!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Melissa M.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Really dope spot. Beer selection is on point and they have some pretty good bartenders for a college area bar... BUT..... the only reason I'm giving this place 4 stars instead of 5 is the one thing I complain about when I read yelp reviews. When ppl take a star away based off something the establishment has no control over. I will be that guy today. The reason this place gets four from me is due to one reason and one reason only that can be summed up in one word.....Thalassa.... R.I.P.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Allen R.", "AuthorLocation": "San Leandro, CA"}

ReviewContent: Nice replacement for thalassa from back in the day lol. The lounging area is much bigger than thalassa for sure. It has a full bar with a great selection of beer. There is a big live music area upstairs where the old pool room used to be. From what I see, it's pretty kid friendly, not sure at night though. They do serve food though I haven't tried it yet. Looks good though. It has a good size outside area that could be bigger, but it's a good place to hang out with friends.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Alex L.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: Really 3.5 stars but I rounded up. The good: Friendly service, huge open space, great location, and a cool concert venue next door. The bad: Beer wasn't as cold as it should have been. Wasn't warm, just wasn't ice cold. The ugly - Had a jazz band tonight that sounded great, but were just playing at too loud of a volume. Meant everyone had to shout to be heard in conversation, thus making it even harder to hear. Advice to management: Turn the volume down a notch - let people converse comfortably with their amigos.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Jay S.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: I love this beer bar/music venue and spacey spacey this place is. The music is POPPIN' because the DJ's here know how to throw some spins. Great beer selection! My favorite one was the mango beer and decent price for pitchers! I was so impressed how they have games in the back as well - 2 bean bag tosses, ping pong tables, and a giant jenga?! Sign me up! There's also a nice fire place outside so YES YES YES!Overall its a fun place to grab a brew/drink and kick it with good company!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Jia Qi F.", "AuthorLocation": "East Bay, CA"}

ReviewContent: Gives off very East Bay, trendy and industrial vibes. Great ambiance and was a perfect for spot for casual get togethers with small or large groups of friends. The interior was very spacious, and had a comfortable lounge area in addition to tables; Something very different from typical Berkeley bars so be prepared to deal with chatter and noise. We chose the "Build Your Own Board" option and chose a variety of cheese and meats, and ordered the cheese fondue all for a very affordable price ranging from $4-6 per selection. The full bar was busy, and was relatively generous with their alcohol. The only down side was that the security guards checking IDs snapped my friend's driver license. We asked to speak to the manager asking for compensation, and we were only given drink vouchers for our next visit.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Arielle I.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: If you're ok with a really loud college-kid hang out, then this is a great place!  I ordered the tri tip dip, and it was really good!  The prices were very reasonable (I don't remember anything being over $12).  My large sandwich and fries was only $10.I felt really old (I'm 35), and not just because of the age difference, but because I felt like my mom screaming to my friend "It's SO loud in here."  We ordered beers right off the bat.  The waiter came back about 5 minutes later to take our food order.  10 minutes later, he brought our food out - really quick service!  However, even after getting our food, we still didn't have our beers.  We waived him down and asked about it - he ran over to the station and brought them, apologizing that he had forgotten about them...He was nice, and it was relatively busy, so I don't think this is the norm.Fun hang out place if you're with a group of friends, but not the place to have a nice conversation over dinner.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Paul A.", "AuthorLocation": "Santa Barbara, CA"}

ReviewContent: One of the worse customer service experiences in a restaurant. Not only did I have to wait a long time after being seated before my server even came to take my order but the entire time she seemed annoyed that I was there. I've seen McDonald's employees have WAY more character and customer service skill than her. I don't even remember her name, just that she was a pregnant lady. The food was good, no complaints there. I'm sitting here still waiting for my check, it's been a while since I finished my dinner too.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Daniel W.", "AuthorLocation": "Redondo Beach, CA"}

ReviewContent: Fun, good people​, good prices, great waitress, excellent selection on beers..... definitely coming back. Shaved tri tip is off the hook.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Gerhard P.", "AuthorLocation": "Richmond, CA"}

ReviewContent: Nice place to grab a beer or two with friends. Although we did not stay for lunch, the menu looks good and affordable.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Christina F.", "AuthorLocation": "Whittier, CA"}

ReviewContent: This is the WORST bar I've been to. If you use an ID from another state DON'T go there. They will tear your ID up, and claiming that they are "checking" it. The guy there folded my ID without my consent! I use that ID for all my flights. I don't know if I'm able to get on my return flights with it.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Tuowen Z.", "AuthorLocation": "Salt Lake City, UT"}

ReviewContent: Cornerstone is huge: there's a large main room, secondary pool room, pristine outside patio. as a dining site, concert venue, scattering place, it's outstanding.their achilles heel is the food. service is suberb. craft beer selection is vast and troublesome.eats: American Burger (9) ordered medium rare-"tomato, mayo, lettuce, red onion, cheddar cheese,"-juice came from lettuce, meat grayish, tasteless, no doubt a frozen patty before-lotsa fries, crispy on outside, mushy on inside. obviously from frozen fries.brew: Hazelnut chocolate Porter, 13 oz, (6)-a strain of bitternest how strange!-best to get samples first.notes:-get samples of beers first, large selection, pricey-food suspect. would avoid.....-service is impeccable, barrista knowledgable on beers.....news on net: "After Comey,, Congressional Republicans Control Trump" (american prospect, 6/9)-"to avoid impeachment, the president has no real choice but to do their bidding".
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Victor G.", "AuthorLocation": "Hayward, CA"}

ReviewContent: Came on two different days after work to find they'd closed the bar early (midnight). Hesitant to give them another chance.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Jake P.", "AuthorLocation": "Batesville, AR"}

ReviewContent: Nice atmosphere, decent beer selection.  Very poor service.  I ordered a beer, got it, no problem.  About 30 minutes later, I attempted to order another.  The bartender made every effort to ignore me, watching me raise my hand and wave at him and turning away.Everyone gets distracted, everyone has a bad day and doesn't want to help customers.  I get that.  But  this was a concerted effort not to serve me.  My accent?  I look like his brother in law?  Who knows.  Not going back
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Anon Y.", "AuthorLocation": "Portland, OR"}

ReviewContent: We got together here with friends and it was really good! The tri tip sandwich was good and really good assortment of beverages. There was live music, ping pong tables, lounge areas etc. Good place to go with friends.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Nina C.", "AuthorLocation": "San Rafael, CA"}

ReviewContent: Walking up to the building I realized this is the old pool hall spot. It is nicely redone with lots of seating. At around 2:30 Me and my boyfriend precede to find a spot at the bar. The bar was full and a couple of full tables inside were empty and all the outside seating was taken. What can I say? They are super under staffed, looked like they were fighting through with a skeleton staff. I waited 5 minutes before was told that someone would be with me. After another five minutes my stomach told me that it has waited long enough. The menu looked promising and I wish I had gotten the opportunity to try some of the yummy beers they have on tap and the food. Sadly I will have to wait for another time.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Cassandra K.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Think Mad Oak but in Berkeley. Some outdoor seating, good-sized beer menu, considerably spacious, nice event space, with the ability to watch some sports on their many (big!) TVs.The bartenders were friendly. They had quite a few things on tap that I've never tried. The lady helping us was patient with our attempts to figure out what exactly we wanted.Prices were decent, if not reflective of increasing costs in the Bay Area. (They really ranged, at the time.)  I only had the French fries, but the rest of the menu looked promising.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Brandon M.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: Most non-bar looking place ever. But it's still fun! There's  a fire place outside for when it's cold at night. Felt like a camp fire vibe almost. There was also a room inside with corn toss, ping pong, and jenga. The drinks are also not as pricey as I expected. $17 for two cocktails. Not bad!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Es T.", "AuthorLocation": "Los Angeles, CA"}

ReviewContent: So i was a huge fan of Thalassa and even had my birthday there once. So needless to say i was very interested in seeing how Cornerstone stood up to the Thalassa days. I am happy to report that the remodel and new Cornerstone Craft Beer is awesome! Me and my roommate came to see Stick Figure last saturday and the venue area is pretty awesome and intimate. it is a great place to see a show. I also loved how once you have your wristband you can go into the restaurant/bar area and order food and drinks and come in and out of the venue area. Overall we really enjoyed our evening and we cant wait to come back whether it is for dinner or a show or both. Good job Cornerstone!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Joe K.", "AuthorLocation": "Contra Costa County, CA"}

ReviewContent: We came to see Stick Figure looking forward to the food that is served before the show. Only to find out, the concert is around the corner, and food is not served at the same venue.  So we sat in the restaurant, sacrificing what would have been a great spot in the line.  3 of us ordered apps and drinks.  Apps showed up within 10 minutes which were ok.  Drinks came 15 minutes after the apps.  We ordered more food, which was decent. ( apps were soft pretzel with fondue, mozz stuffed meatball, and macaroni & cheese balls.  Our later order was pork belly nachos, and a shared burger.  Burger was pretty darn good.  Mac & cheese balls were pretty good too.  All else was mediocre.  Drinks were comped, and our server was tipped $20 on a $65 tab because it was not her fault.  Bar staff needs some serious training and help.Now for the concert venue.....The stage was nice, and the space was intimate... we were excited to see Stick Figure in such an intimate setting.  Well, it was so hot in there. Easily 85 defrees + and Zero ventilation, and we lasted 45 minutes.  The plus;  good drinks at a fair price,  and cheap concert tickets.Cornerstone, dial in the bar at the restaurant, and please cool down the concert venue.  Figure out a way to bring in that beautiful bay air.  You are doomed without either
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Steve S.", "AuthorLocation": "Brentwood, CA"}

ReviewContent: Cornerstone took over for the space that Thalassa used to be in, but no fear Berkeley beer goers, this place is pretty cool and lives up to the hype that once used to be the fun Thalassa. DRINKS: With several beer options on tap, anything can be enjoyed by anybody! I will say on the pricier side of places, but now that the Bay Area has gotten more expensive, that $7 pint of beer now is more of the standard. They have a ton of local choices as well some normal distributed beers from across the nation, so you can really find whatever you like. Although beer is their specialty, you can always get something else here too. ATMOSPHERE: There's the outside seating area and then there are plenty of tables and space inside the bar. There are even 'concerts' here according to some of the pamphlets around the bar. I will say, you can bring a group of friends and snag a table to get comfortable and enjoy a round of drinks. Overall, one of the better establishments now in the downtown Berkeley area for a good drink and socializing time. The weekends will obviously be cramped and full, but when a place is this good ...!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Albert H.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: It was ok. Awful service. We sat there so long the manager came over and asked us what beer we were waiting on. So so beer, not what I'd call a well curated draft list. They have a menu but I was told you couldn't order anything but a burger. Not sure whose bright idea it was to open but somehow be incapable of cooking the full menu. I know what you're thinking,  BBJ this place doesn't sound ok, but the burger was good.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Big Baby Jesus C.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: Been here 3 times in one month so needless to say I'm a fan! This was exactly the type of place I was hoping would open as a resident of downtown Berkeley. It's a great alternative to Jupiter and it has everything I look for in a hang out spot: wide variety of beers, outdoor seating, games, music, and apparently now food! The times I've visited hadn't offered food yet, but I see from Yelp that this has changed. Hell yeah. Their outside area is wonderful. No wind or street noise because of how closed off it is. My favorite area is the game room, which offers table tennis, corn hole, and giant jenga. My only worry is that it's going to get so popular that we'll have to start waiting in line to play the games! Hah. Thank you for choosing downtown berkeley, Cornerstone.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Emma W.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: Expansive beer selection, but it didn't fit with the season. Too many porters and stouts during spring. Also the pours are pretty tiny for the amount they are charging; $7 for a 13oz pour of a 5.7% beer! Had an expensive, disappointing and tasteless pretzel with gruyere cheese too. It is a big space with a nice back patio, a game room with ping pong tables and other games. I'd like to check it out when there's live music, so I may update after checking that out.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Ryan S.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Trying this place for the first time. LUCKILY the manager was very understanding and helpful. If it wasn't for her, I would give 1 star. The atmosphere is dry and the service it slow. A tube burst and soaked the side of me within 20 minutes of arriving. The I told the waitress what happened and she had ZERO affect. I asked for a towel and she got one--to clean up the floor. Hopefully they are able to improve for a better experience.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Mina R.", "AuthorLocation": "Rodeo, CA"}

ReviewContent: Love it here, great space to play or just hang out, great music and a fantastic outdoor space and good beer selection. I'm not wild about the food, but everything else here works so well, I'm happy to overlook that, I'm coming here for fun and beer.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Andrea Y.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Back in my day, this place was known as Thalassa, a place for some brew and pool tables galore. Well, about 10 years later while attending an event my friend was DJ'ing, I see that this place is no longer called Thalassa, but Cornerstone Craft Beer! I mean, Thalassa is a way cooler name, which if you didn't know, means "sea" versus Pangaea meaning "land." It was a déjà vu-ish moment walking up to the entrance, bringing me back to my college days.Anyway, the issue here is that the service is super whack. Maybe the bartenders are young or they don't like dealing with the young college crowd, but dang they are slow and it's as if they are ignoring you. I get it, burn out is real. So is a customer service job though.This place pretty much has everything that people who like to chill, want. So, that means alcohol, long tables, fire pits, ping pong, big jenga, big connect 4, music (live and DJ), makeshift dance floor, couches, etc.I might be back because my friend DJs here, but I won't expect any quick service.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Marlon T.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: Love this place! I've been here a few times and always enjoy it. The staff here are always so friendly - very laid back and definitely knowledgable about the beer that they offer. If you're unsure where to start - you can tell them what you like and they'll recommend options that you'll genuinely enjoy
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Min H.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Good place to chill to have drinks and food. Very low key. Dim lighting inside. We were able to seat ourselves right away. Food came faster than my drinks. Fries tasted normal. Drinks were standard.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Crystal H.", "AuthorLocation": "Milpitas, CA"}

ReviewContent: Awesome spot!! My friend and I came here to grab a drink on Thursday night. I had been to Thalasaa before but I think I enjoy this space more! There's plenty of room, both inside and outside. The night we went, there was a reggae concert going on in one of the bigger rooms. But there was still a lot of room in both the inside bar and outside area! Even when it's chilly out, the fireplaces outside will be sure to warm you up. Full bar, but also tons of beers! Definitely come by and check it out!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Noelle H.", "AuthorLocation": "Alameda, CA"}

ReviewContent: Wide selection of spirits, great food, very reasonable prices and lots of live entertainment. The dinner jazz guys were not too loud yet exceptionally creative and enjoyable to listen to. The separate concert room (an old car dealership showroom) featured Petty Theft. These guys can definitely quit their day jobs. They had the place rockin!!! All very talented musicians who love to play not just amazing Tom Petty but Steve Miller and others.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Irv B.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great place to grab a beer or cocktail. Food is great and they also have live music! Very hot bar scene at night.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Just Another Hungry Guy C.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: This review is for the music venue only, didn't really spend much time in the bar. I saw a show by Polica that lasted one hour. Just as I was getting into it the show was over. They immediately turned on the bright lights, we felt like cattle being kicked out, it was incredibly unpleasant and totally ruined the vibe created by the concert. I know it's standard practice to turn on the lights but this felt excessive for a small venue like this. The number of security guards was also kind of excessive, not the first thing you want to see just as a dreamy set by Polica is over. The drinks were cheap but not good. I think this venue should be a lot more chill if they want to create pleasant concert experiences.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Tijana P.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: Disclaimer: I haven't been here during peak hours.Found this place described as "hot and new" on Yelp and thought I'd give it a try. Visited this place with a few friends on a Wednesday evening. The place is pretty huge and they have a good selection of beers which is always great. Since it was not crowded we got to hangout at their live performance area where they had two ping pong tables, a giant jenga set and a few corn holes. We played ping pong for about two hours as we didn't have anyone waiting on the tables and it was so much fun to do that with a pint of amazing beer.They also have an open backyard with fire places to chill. Overall, this place is simply amazing to have a good time with a crowd.Looking forward to watching a live music show here soon.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Prem S.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Coolest new club in Berkeley hands down !!....Went and saw The Offspring at a Sold-Out benefit for 924 Gilman Street !!  Great sound system & lighting...PERFECT SIZE ROOM....Had a beer and it was very cold & tasty (& reasonably priced too) Totally cool vibe in the club....Way cool.campfire pits out back with a projection of the band playing live on the wall...You could watch the show from the outside without having to pay for the gig !!.I ordered the Tri Tip sandwich & it was exquisite with huge portions of meat on a giant soft french roll !! The East Bay has been lacking any cool clubs for the last decade or so & I'm so happy THERE is FINALLY A COOL MUSIC VENUE IN BERKELEY! MAJOR CAUSE for Celebration! Highly recommended for a killer meal & cool tunes !!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Harald O.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: This is a great place to spend an evening with friends. They have a large selection of beers on tap and are happy to do tastings before you order. The space is very large and comfy and they have a live music stage / venue at the back along with some games.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Ankit A.", "AuthorLocation": "Greenbrae, Kentfield, CA"}

ReviewContent: I used to like Thalassa a lot and have been hoping some good businesses to fill this empty spot. My experience at Cornerstone was pretty nice, although I went there on a weekday night, which might not be quite representative if you are looking for some large crowd experiences.As a bar, they offer plenty of drinks, including more than 30 beers on tap. Also, for most of their tap beers, you can choose a smaller short footed glass beside the regular pint glass. This serves very well for some of my friends who want to try different kinds but not drink too much. The bartenders were very friendly as well. I have never tried their food though.The entire setup was very nice as well. It is very spacious and seats are big and away from each other. While half of the place are general tables for food and drinks, the other half have a stage and a big open area. When there is not a show, the area is equipped with two table tennis tables, two corn hole setups, and a giant Jenga. Besides, there is an outdoor area with fire pits. Overall, I think this setup can basically satisfy a wide range of preferences.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Xian S.", "AuthorLocation": "Irvine, CA"}

ReviewContent: I will never come to a show at this place again. I didn't see any signs saying "no crowd surfing or stage diving" but security was dragging people out in choke holds acting like they just committed a major crime. And every time security kicked someone out for doing the above, it took like 5 of them to unnecessarily bulldoze through the crowd and knock people over. I've been to so many different shows at a variety of different venues and have never seen security act like this. Either put some signs up or chill out when you see people crowd surfing at a punk show!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Anjelica G.", "AuthorLocation": "Concord, CA"}

ReviewContent: I just opened and was still pretty empty when I was there but with a few more customers it will be a great place. The beers are $6 to $7 generally and they a lot of beers on draft. No food yet.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Theobald T.", "AuthorLocation": "Washington, DC"}

ReviewContent: Great new bar! Awesome addition to the downtown Berkeley scene. Friendly, helpful staff and an excellent atmosphere.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Lindsay K.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great place! Very friendly bar tenders. Great selection of beers. Decent selection of spirits. Love the ping pong, corn hole and giant Jenga! Looking forward to trying their food.Excited about the upcoming concerts in their event space.They just soft opened and are naturally working out the kinks.P.s. The whiney people leaving bad reviews need to find another hobby. It's not Cornerstone's fault that you have a stick up your ass, you self-important colostomy bags.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Cyrus N.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Awesome beer place to have a selection of 40 beers on tap!-very friendly and knowledgeable service staff.  I was helped by a friendly bartender named Tyler.  Friendly vibe and atmosphere.  I highly recommend this place!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Attila V.", "AuthorLocation": "Petaluma, CA"}

ReviewContent: Decided to try this place out with my wife after hearing nothing but good things from others.  I was impressed!  Awesome drinks, prices, service, and atmosphere!  I definitely found my new favorite spot in the East Bay!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Nima F.", "AuthorLocation": "San Jose, CA"}

ReviewContent: Cornerstone...good vibe at first sight. My wife and I, on the way to La Note (our fav French spot) passed Cornerstone and instantly wished we had time for it. La Note graciously pushed back our reservation so that we could try out Cornerstone. My wife enjoyed a great white wine, while I ordered two Manhattans, made according to the preferences of the Bar Dude. The Bar Dude is legit. His choices for mixing drinks proves it. This place isn't just hip, it's also cool and, if you're old enough, swell! Oh, also check out the color-coded beer menu, it's a smart way to help choose a drink.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Yelp I.", "AuthorLocation": "Tacoma, WA"}

ReviewContent: When Thalassa closed, I was excited to see what would replace it. We happened upon this place since we were driving down Shattuck the night before and saw that the lights were on! Came here with a big group around 8PM on a Friday night and it wasn't packed (but given this place is huge). It seemed like a soft opening when we came so we really got to check the place out. Compared to the old Thalassa that was dark/mysterious/and a little sketch at times this place was open/bright/and clean lol. It's an interesting place since you have a sitting area in the front, large bar to the left, firepits/smal stage in the back, and ping-pong/cornhole/larger stage in the back left. TBH I think this place has a lot going on. Good or bad, I guess we'll have to see.  I can't give this place a 5 yet since there were tons of ping pong balls on the ground in the back since they don't limit how many you can check out, but have it in a big bowl. The place would be better if they let you write your name down to check out a table/limit your time there since people were at the tables for hours. Same for the cornhole. I like that they'll probably have open mics or artists playing throughout the night since they were doing sound checks. However, it did get hard to chat with people & hear once they started doing that. They have a good assortment on tap & seems like they'll be opening another bar area near the ping pong tables. Drinks seemed cheaper than usual though since we got around 6 drinks for only $35. No complaints on my end though since they did have some Golden State, Goose Island, and others that I've never heard of before. They're still not up and running completely, so I did feel like there was something missing from the place/to make it the next go to spot. Come check this place out while everything is still new and clean!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Keizzel C.", "AuthorLocation": "Portland, OR"}

ReviewContent: Hats off to the pappys team for revitalizing this spot.  Amazing job.I'm looking forward to visiting this with family, friends, etc.  Great for all ages, etc.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Tom M.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}

ReviewContent: Very cool new spot to grab a beer or cocktail with friends. Has a firepit, corn-hole, and all the usual Faire necessary for a pleasant evening. Looking forward to seeing a show here, from the looks of their backroom it could be a pretty cool place to watch live music.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Nick H.", "AuthorLocation": "Orinda, CA"}

ReviewContent: I enjoyed the Goose Island Stout but it was poured in a wine glass with some spilt down the stem. Short stemmed snifter would have been better?I'm not sure if I got a full pour because of the spill. :(They did a real good job remodeling from Thelassa. Open spaces with lots of lounging areas. They might need fans to keep the flies away from the open air areas. They are not fully up to prime time. Food service is slated to start next week during Spring Break (last week of March)Their taps are numerous, extensive, and clean. They also have a full bar for cocktails. I'm sure they will improve over time but I think I'll wait to return in a few months
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Michael Q.", "AuthorLocation": "Vacaville, CA"}

ReviewContent: This place is amazing! I'm so excited it's finally open. Currently, they're doing Beer & Cocktail service with live music on the weekends. The owners took their time to show us around the venue and let us know what they're planning, really made us feel like we were welcome. We tried a few cocktails during our visit. True quality in their drinks, I can't wait for the food!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Natalie G.", "AuthorLocation": "Modesto, CA"}

ReviewContent: Dooope spot! DEFINITELY come here for the craft cocktails & their amazing selection of craft beers on tap. Cool outdoor area to chill at with a couple fire pits if you want some fresh air. The lounge usually has a DJ playing & the music venue, for the time being, has ping pong tables & some other game where you throw a sack in the hole. I don't know what the game is called lol. They haven't advertised their opening yet so it isn't super packed at the moment, but it's nice cause then you get to talk to the cool staff. I'm sooo excited to see what kind of shows they're gonna have there! I'll definitely be there for the first one!
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Janelli B.", "AuthorLocation": "Brooklyn, NY"}

ReviewContent: Incredible beer list, especially for being so new.  I am excited to see what shows they will have in the large venue.  Saw a local group play the other night and the sound is fantastic.  Friendly bar staff, I can't wait until the kitchen opens to see the place really thrive.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Derrik B.", "AuthorLocation": "San Francisco, CA"}

ReviewContent: Atmosphere was phenomenal. Customer service was terrible. My ID was almost broken in half as I came in and although my friends were allowed in, they were denied being served. When I tried to talk to the bartender about it, they all walked away and then finally listened until walking away mid conversation. I would love to give them a second chance, but doubt I'll waste my money there again. I can't afford this beer and replacing my ID at the same time. Best of luck surviving business here.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Kerry O.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great space for drinking with a group. Large selection of beers. Fire pits and live music
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Kimi H.", "AuthorLocation": "Berkeley, CA"}

ReviewContent: Great combination of music venue & beer garden w/ a full bar. Great selection of beer and a modern industrial rustic decor. 42 taps in the main area and a wide open back patio with fire pits. The large music venue side has ping pong, corn hole and giant Jenga when there aren't live shows. I just can't wait for the first show.
Metadata: {"YelpName": "Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music", "AuthorName": "Raymond P.", "AuthorLocation": "Oakland, CA"}
